She replied and said to get a picture of the water outside next time, that the drain is not blocked and that it is strange that it just happened to me, even though I'm almost certain that was not the case. She then said she was closing the matter until I had further proof that the water was from outside. I moved out of the property shortly after.

The apartment building itself was just a large house converted into 4 units so there was no soundproofing and you can hear everything your neighbours do.

This place is a solid old house with rock-star views but unfortunately owned by overseas [REDACTED] investors who are only concerned with when to knock it down.  They booted my family out after demanding a 40% increase in rent which I could not agree to because we were already paying well above market rates for the house.  It was ultimately let after we moved out for $200 a week LESS than we paid.  That is not a misprint - the landlord had to REDUCE the rent to let it.  Needless to say the entire house is falling apart, the gutters are all blocked and the landlord refuses to clean them, the kitchen faces west and does not have a window that opens and there isn't an exhaust fan - we called it "the sauna".  However, we actually liked the house because of the view and sadly for all involved would have been happy to continue renting it.  The awful, greedy landlord has only themselves to blame.  Oh yeah, the landlord sacked the agent we originally dealt with at the same time they evicted us without cause (we were on a periodic) because they claimed the old agents "weren't doing their job" - i.e. screwing enough money out of the tenant.  You have been warned.

Whilst living there the house was infested with cockroaches. Backsplash fell off the wall, was not fixed. The pipes under the house have a root growing through them, so on multiple seperate occasions during my residency there whilst showering in the downstairs bathroom,  there would be a sudden gurgle and then RAW sewerage would spit UP into the shower and the bathroom floor drain onto you and the floor. The real estate and owner are aware of the issue and then claimed my whole bond saying they did a UV blue light scan or something and found animal faeces on the floor and claimed the entire bond, that they had to completely retile and grout the house because of the HUMAN waste….. After chatting with the neighbour not long after leaving, they told us a week after the new people moved in, they had the sewer truck out the again, clear the roots for 6 months until the issue arises again

Apartment is great during the warmer months, as soon as temperatures drops the entire apartment is covered in mould. We'd have water dripping on our face from all the condensation cumulating on the window over night. Had to wipe windows down every single day as they were covered in water just as it had rained inside the house. All furniture was covered in mould, clothes, shoes everything. Landlord just said we didn't ventilate the apartment enough. You can't expect tenants to sleep with windows open in the winter.

We were evicted because we raised that windows didn't close , rot and mould & rain pouring into sagging ceiling in bathroom . I was and qualified handyman's work and went to hospital . Possums would enter the house through the weird hole above the stove and through the windows that would not close. There were no window coverings. The back door was so rotted and would blow open on windy weather flooding the carpeted area in the back . There were smells that I've never smelt before in that house that I assume a possum faeces urine, perhaps . Their reasons to evict was the landlord's daughter is suicidal because she was living too far from work and will move inn. She did not . They completely renovated and released the house . We were the second people to ever live in that property . I met the woman who built it with her husband who died in that house . A Google search can show you what the house used to look like and what it looks like now he can also tell you the dates of when it was listed to rent again only months after we left. The current tenants daughter goes to school with my daughter. The agents have said things that we did to the house that were on true. It sounds like people broke in and smashed all the windows after we had left. I am still waiting on my V cat hearing date because of the backlog from Covid
Blackmail Tenants
Mould problem wasn't addressed

I rented this property for $750 p/w - BE WARNED 2 Wentworth Street as a building has huge water and mould problems throughout the building effecting all residents - the property looks new and modern the whole thing has cement rot and mould issues. Unit 210 was cold and damp and had major mould problems which the agent did not fix. I woke up to wet bedsheets, my salt lamp had puddles of water around it, my wooden dining table was covered in mould, so much stuff had to be replaced after living here.  I hired professional dehumidifiers that cost $2,000 and moved into an air BnB for two weeks paid by me to fix the issues - a few weeks later everything felt wet and damp again. The agent was completely dreadful to deal with, very rude  and at the end of the tenancy in peak summer heat the air conditioning unit broke (which was located on the roof - the roof was too badly damaged from water to be safe for anyone to go up there) so i spend 8 weeks with no air conditioning in the middle of 30+ C heat. they gave me a paltry $30 discount for this URGENT repair they never bothered to fix. They rented it out for $850 p/w when i left.

Circa 2018, this house had some very serious problems, including a sewer that regularly overflowed into the back yard. After several years of barely maintaining anything, the owners painted the entire inside of the house while we were still living there without compensating us for the weeks of disruption, then kicked us out a couple of months later.

Note that this property is not currently for rent. But was previously a rental and could be one again in future. 
Mould. In the bedrooms. Circa 2015. LL/RE couldn't have cared less about it, told us to wipe it down, wouldn't get in mould expert, purchased dehumidifiers then tried to get us to pay for them. Engineering report for the property showed it was an issue for 3/4 ground floor units.  LL/RE finally let us break lease then took us to VCAT for our bond for refusing to clean the mould. Thankfully we won. Didn't stop the LL from putting new tenants in. The property was later put on the market and then sold.

The entire building is very old. This studio has poor ventilation and retains heat in the summer. The oven barely warms the food. Shared laundry machines at the basement were unclean/moudly. Really wouldn't recommend this property unless you are desperate for housing.

Had to pay for my own repairs for a terrible property that was falling apart. Left the place better off than when it was left with us. After we cleared the place out and did their repairs for them. We left the place spotless and they hit us with a cleaning fee after they had a painter come in. The cleaners were there to clean up after the painters and the real estate agent had us pay the bill from our bond. We had to pay it.
Mould problem wasn't addressed
7 months of mushrooms growing out of the kitchen wall. Horrendous back and forth with the Real Estate "Property Manger". Lodged a case with VTAC 1 year ago and still waiting.

Lived here in 2016.

Bit of a dive. Wardrobe was falling apart and the drawers didn't work. Likewise the kitchen was a shit hole, the oven didn't work and when the agency finally had an electrician come to “fix” it after us asking for months he laughed and declared it “the oldest oven he'd ever seen”. It was finally replaced. 
Kitchen cupboards had cockroaches living in them, definitely hadn't been cleaned before we arrived. Kitchen window had a broken screen, as did the back door. Meant that doors couldn't be left open for the breeze due to the mozzies. Bathroom was ancient and tiles were cracked all over, toilet had a huge chunk of porcelain missing. As far as I knew the landlord was a nice man but the agency never told him when we needed things fixed. 

The kicker was when we were moving out I cleaned extensively and waited for the agency to show prospective tenants through the house,  the lazy bitch never showed up but the prospective tenants DID show up and I had to show them through myself!! 

We did have aircon and a little garden which was a plus.

The house is filled with mould. The air conditioning unit has not been serviced or replaced in a very long time. The walls are covered in marks from blue yak being used everywhere, the back porch roof leaks and makes the light flicker, dodgy electrics throughout the entire place including PowerPoints that don't work. The pool cost us thousands to keep clean due to an old and improper working filtration system. Broken windows that will continue to break as there is no way to keep them open without them crashing down. The real estate company are extremely inexperienced and unprofessional. They ignore requests for help until you call and prefer to say things over the phone rather than in written form.

This property had a serious mould problem throughout the years we lived there, and it just kept getting worse with every storm season and freezing winter. No matter how often we cleaned it away, it would grow back, and our ceilings were too tall for us to clean without proper equipment. When we asked the agency to send a professional to clean the mould for these reasons, they said something along the lines of "the mould has always been there so it's not a problem we're responsible for." A few days later the agency sent out a mass email telling tenants to keep their windows open during winter to stop mould from growing.

The second big issue with this property is the bathroom plumbing. About once a year the sealing around the toilet base would disintegrate and the toilet would seriously leak. The roots of a neighbour's tree had grown through the pipes, and one plumber (not the plumber the agency would send out, but one we booked separately) told us and the agency that the problem would keep happening unless the roots were cut away. Despite this, the agency would push back when we requested they send a plumber to fix the issue.

My housemates and I have all moved out and the property has since been given a fresh coat of paint and some other work -- but based on the agency's very lazy history, we're not confident they actually fixed any of the issues, and we'd like to warn future tenants about the rampant mould and annual leak.

Lived here for 11 years and only moved because I needed more room for teenagers.  Absolutely brilliant owners who care about the property and treat you fairly.  Went beyond basic repairs including installing shelving in the laundry when requested. The apartment was in good condition and well cared for with good quality appliances, fixtures and fittings.  

Other tenants in the building usually very good with low turnover.  Overall building in reasonable condition but bodycorp reluctant to invest money in the building and in recent years cut back on cleaning common areas, which was unfortunate as the building started to look a bit messy due to carpeted hallways. 

Rent increases were either very low or non-existent as we always negotiated a longer lease in exchange for no increase.  I often had 2-3 year leases.  

Agent was always responsive and a pleasure to deal with.

Sewerage pipes in courtyard cracked and unfixed, they fill with plant material blocking it all up. Roof leaks soaking old carpeted floors. Carpet very old, thinned out, torn throughout, can see underlay in places and due to leaking is probably full of mould. Can see underside of neighbouring house through massive gaps between wall and sunken in floor. Advertised as sound proof from the busy street but no part of it is. Outdoor alley down to bathroom advertised as completely waterproof but is not at all. Tiny outdoor bathroom has no ventilation and has outdoor rubber mats covering the ground as a floor. Impossible to manage vermin problem. Cupboards are old and falling apart.

Owners of the property were entitled and narcissistic.
Everything was OUR fault and the agency was just as bad. 
Wooden floors were rotting, illegal electrical wiring, mould and damp patches everywhere.

Mold in carpets, false advertising, upstairs neighbours are abusive. R&H have been more than unhelpful when I left due to Domestic violence, I was abused by my property manager for breaking lease. Please go elsewhere

Sooooo Loud! Busiest road in Manly, regularly woken up by trucks & busses, not to mention the street sweepers, very thin windows, can feel the vibrations. 
The owners wanted to do some rennos, take out the carpet & put in Lino, but wouldn't drop the rent at all, very unreasonable. Kept sending tradesmen for quotes twice a week, for 6 weeks, couldn't believe it. Broke my lease to get out.

The place was in an appalling state of disrepair. The only bedroom seemed to have had the carpet ripped out and floorboards sanded (it smelt deeply of chemicals). In the living room the heater had been pulled from the wall, and the blinds broken. Instead of kitchen cabinet doors, there were dirty rags hanging on pieces of twine - the floor was visibly grubby throughout. I have pictures to substantiate these observations. An utter disgrace.

Over 10 months of the shower leaking through the floor, out through the ceiling in the kitchen/laundry. RE wouldn't fix it causing more damage, multiple tradesmen said it's concerning and longer damage will cause the top floor to give way. Long term damage, and small repairs to bathroom

Consistent leaks resulting in excessive mold that the agency knew about and did nothing to fix. The leaks were a result of a lack of waterproofing upstairs which they were aware of but did not alert prospective tenants of prior to loving in during the wettest winter Sydney had ever recorded. I had to throw away half of my clothes as a result and they did nothing to compensate me for this.

Nice view over middle harbour sucked me in along with somewhat affordable rent of 1650/ week....but the humidifier and doors and windows being wide open should have clued me in.along with the smell I tried getting rid of for a year, the mould in the ceiling and slugs that made their way into the kitchen. Coupled with rotting eavestroughs, garage that would flood, rotted out baseboards and doors, the worst bathroom I've ever seen and corroded kitchen cabinet joints - let's say I was happy to get out of there when tge owner sold tge house (after telling is they would renew). Combined with the worst rental agent who would never do anything, it was an eye-opening first experience as a renter for my family of four, newly arrived from overseas. Goodbye alma street and good riddance!

- no functioning stove for the first 3 weeks of our tenancy (on the listing, all amenities were in working order) - the stove has since been fixed. 
- the linoleum floor in the kitchen is able to be peeled up, its not stuck down with anything. 
- the " range hood" in the kitchen was disgusting, dirty, covered in grease and really just consisted of a hole above the stove. 
- Kitchen cupboards were stained blue on the inside, we don't know why. It looks like someone had dropped a can of bright blue paint on the inside and it's just splattered everywhere.  
- The initial gas stove did not pass the safety, and thus an entirely new gas line had to be installed.
- Heating was virtually non existent. One split system in the lounge room which could not even heat the lounge room. 
- The bath is almost completely rusted, and the enamel is flaking off in large chunks. Landlord refused to fix it. To the best of my knowledge it remains unfixed. 
- The plumbing in the apartment above unit 2 burst one day, and flooded our bathroom. 
- Black mould in the bathroom due to no ventilation. When brought up with the property manager, we were told that black mould had 'never been an issue' in the bathroom before... despite the complete lack of ventilation and 15ft ceilings. (a rather small fan has since been installed). 
- Rising damp in the hallway
- a power point which did not pass the electrical safety test (and has since been repaired).

LL will show up unannounced and claim it's his right to access garage/shed he built on property because there is a chicken wire fence between it and the new boundary line he's created without any council approval. Rocks up with wife and kids in toe early morning on weekends. Complains about making necessary repairs due to leaking roof and moisture issues from under the house flooding when it rains.  Refused to repair broken fly screens, screen doors windows. Was threatening and just all around horrible to deal with.  Happily bumped up rental price with no repairs.

In a not so surprising twist the property manager (which is in the building under the dwelling) is also the landlord. He entered the property without notice and authority (when  my partner was on the toilet with gastro). Would often enter the courtyard without permission, wouldn't get things fixed, would have trades people working on the roof directly outside the windows with no notice (not fun waking up naked to random tradies). Quizzed my partner and I (at the time same sex presenting) as to why the second room didn't have a bed in it. “But where do you sleep? And where do they sleep?”. Took a while to get bone back. Accepted mail on our behalf and then would lose it or deny it, even though their office emailed to advise they had it. 10/10 jerk.

Lived here for a year. Fresh paint job covering up black mould infesting all the walls and floorboards, lost at least half our belongings in the move because we just had to throw.everything out. Advertised as having AirCon, of the three units the only one that DOESN'T have the power cord cut is so old the tech couldn't find a digital manual to fix it. 
Big crawlspace hole above 2nd toilet. Fence is rotted and blew over in strong winds. Garage door can only be rolled up when it feels like it. Back door often didn't lock properly. "Bath" can fit an adult only if you're sitting curled up in fetal position, which is what you'll want to do. As soon as we moved out they tried to keep our bond. Immediately re-listed still advertising with air-con, and for $50 cheaper. Landlords never inspected, never responded to any requests, including for a working back door.

Room has huge windows. Seems great but it means there is no insulation from outside so the apartment is always stinking hot or freezing cold. Also any noise from outside can be heard clearly from inside. There is a refrigeration unit from the nextdoor bottleshop which hums clearly day and night. It took about a month to get used to the hum. The hot water only lasts about 5 mins. Otherwise it's a big studio in a good location with few residential neighbours.
The owner is crazy the whole street celebrated them leaving!!! Also they are diy people that use cheap crap. Refused to go half's in a fence and did their own electrical work

The owner of the property lives next door at number 62, and they will make constantly make complaints about you and breach your right to peaceful enjoyment. Frivolous bond claims at the end of the tenancy and unreasonable cleaning expectations like pressure washing all the pathways and driveway.

The house is falling apart. The floors were coming up. Water comes in through the light fitting in the lounge room and through ceiling in the kitchen. The hallway and the step into the kitchen are up a big step, that step is sinking and the whole front of the house is pull away from the back half of the house. There is a significant mold issue. There was a huge slug issue. The paint was peeling because of the moisture. I've got videos and photos as proof. I lived there for 5 years,

ducted heating unit in roof attic with vents in celing roses. most inefficient and useless heating ever. $700+ per month electricity bill last winter. Owner refuses to replace it and says I should be grateful she hasnt increased my rent (i.e. so stop complaning!).

Extensive damp problems from a range of longstanding issues. The landlord owned 3/4 apartments and had allowed the entire building to fall into disrepair. The bathroom upstairs had breached into our apartment below & the whole place had such bad rising damp that the internal walls literally leaked water. They then ripped out the wall in the primary bedroom to “repair” the damp, which took months and meant we had to sleep in the living room, which we were never compensated for. Once they had finished, it was apparent that the repair work completed had been done in almost every room of the house, despite the agency claiming to us and later the NCAT that this problem had never been previously identified.

As a result of the damp, which was never under 90% humidity, everything went mouldy and after trying our best to manage it we tried extensively to have the agent address it unsuccessfully. In one instance the agent stated that the damp was due to use “showering and then going to work” and leaving the house closed up. The agency refused to give us the contact details of the landlord and on the lease where the contact details legally should be, they had a phone number that redirected back to the agency.

When taking them to the NCAT they asked the independent contractor who came to test the humidity to withhold the report from us (which the contractor admitted after initially promising to give us the report then later refusing). Though we won our claim, the whole ordeal was awful, including the landlord accusing us of having “brought in the mould from [our] previous home”.

The place was a total nightmare. Also there was so little insulation between our apartment and the one above that you could hear every footstep and make out their conversations.
moved into a filthy house. charged a $600 cleaning fee at the end of lease (property was clean!). Half of the house was knocked down and renovated the following month.

UNETHICAL BUSINESS PRACTISES. BLACKMAIL TENANTS. [REDACTED] When we first leased our property they had property management staff and the lady we were initially dealing with was excellent. During covid with everything they laid off staff and the wife started dealing with us directly. It became a bit more challenging but was still fine. When our tenancy finished we of course did the final clean through a cleaning company and also had the foresight to have another company complete an independent exit report (they also did an entry report for us as well). As the property was left in pristine condition we didn't think there would be any problems with getting our bond back. Imagine my surprise when the wife informs me that she is keeping our bond and forwards me a bogus exit report. I challenge her and inform her that I had both an entry and exit report done by a third party and forward her these. I inform her that if she looks at the entry report she will note that all the items she is trying to keep my bond for were clearly identified in  the entry report…. Both our independent report and her agency report. She goes silent. I then inform her that I have engaged legal counsel to deal with this on my behalf and I receive a flood of excuses from her saying that she is not trying to profit from illegally keeping my bond and that it's been a tough year and that [REDACTED] etc….. some real crazy stuff. She then goes on to admit that she has illegally kept my bond, but only to get me back to do another clean before she shows the place to new renters as it has now been some 2 weeks since we moved. She goes on to tell me in writing that “all agents do this” and not to take it personally. I inform her that this is blackmail and illegal and agin advise her to go through my lawyers, who have also at this point contacted fair trading. More woe are me email excuses pursue along with an email informing me that she is taking stress leave and will be non-contactable. Anyway, I have the full chain of emails and if I'm doubt and happy to share. I seriously couldn't believe the level of crazy I had to deal with here. I work in real estate so know my rights, however it did make me wonder how many less informed tenants she does this too and I can't even imagine the level of stress this must cause for renters. Steer well clear of these guys, unethical and crazy to boot!
Mould, windows do not seal, old carpet, dry rot, ant infestation

The property doesn't appear to have been renovated since it was built in the 1970s. Apart from that a drug seller/user lived in the property for the last 9 months. Two people including him died in the property of [REDACTED] in 1.5 months and the police crime scene investigators took photos of the blood stain left by the second death. Extremely disturbing and I wouldn't want to live there. The property managers have no interest in what substances were used and remain in the property.

The house was so so freezing. Despite having 2 wall heaters, the one in the hallway did nothing, and the one in the living room barely warmed the room. Comes with a decorative non-working, kind of dirty wood fired stove and tiled over fireplace with a strange pipe sticking out of it. But the bathroom is actually nice, and it has 3 good sized bedrooms with massive wardrobes.

When we moved in the bathroom light was broken and it took more than a month + lots of pestering the real estate company to fix it. We found out from the previous tenants that it'd been broken for a few months before they moved out. From what the real estate company said the delay seemed to be more on the landlord.

Very cute older apartment that gets amazing morning and afternoon sun. And the kitchen and bathroom are pretty good/modern.

When I lived there the carpet was very old and starting to fall apart but it looks like they've replaced it. You get possums (or rats? idk) in the roof, and sometimes they knocked one of the bathroom lights partially out of it's socket, dropping animal poop into the bathroom. I just stuck some tape over the socket and it was fine.

The apartment is well presented with view of ongoing construction across the road. The bedroom windows are not double glazed and the noise of traffic and ambulances headed to Royal Perth will disturb your sleep every night. 
Also watch out for sneaky charges on end of lease inspection. We had to take them to court over attempts to retain entire bond over imaginary damages. Luckily we had photos taken at possession and end of lease and judge agreed to our position.

There's a broken metal pool fence piece attached to two rusty metal poles via cable ties, as a makeshift handrail on the stairs case to enter the property. Someone thoughtfully added a ceramic mug on top of pole to help prevent you cutting your hand and getting tetanus. Upon entering the home in the lounge you have a large bay window which blows open whenever it's windy. There's blue tac where the latch is, to assist it. 
The toilet room has windows permanently open making the house sub zero in winter.the bathroom however has no ventilation, so it's full of black mould. Outside you have a deck with no railing whatsoever, with a hell of a drop. Off that is a sunroom which floods each time it rains. A very large corner of one part of the yard has tree stumps, shards of metal, large bones, bits of broken concrete and brick all intertwined with the lawn, so you get a sparky surprise attempting to mow that.

Black mould covering almost entire house ceiling, mushrooms growing out of shower, plants growing out of walls in the living room, the third bedroom did not properly built walls and was almost definitely not legal. Lived at the property for about a year and the agent did nothing about any issues despite constantly trying to contact them.

Very minimal maintenance done in almost 4 year lease. 
Gutters never cleaned until they flooded and damaged the ceiling and walls in several rooms in the house causing black mould which was painted over and not professionally removed. 
Several outlet plugs and ceiling lights had exposed wires and would trip the power, was rectified over a year later in 1 room but main living area wasn't fixed until after notice to vacate. 
Had rats, possum and cats living in the roof that was exposed completely at the rear and disturbed us at all hours of the day and night our entire lease.
The garage was falling apart as there was a crack and the garage was on a lean since before we moved into the property which was repaired by a dodgy company that lied and extorted $500 from tenants because they refused to come do repairs when tenant was home after 12pm and came unannounced at 6.40am to harass pregnant wife and claimed it had beens arranged with husband already, which it wasn't!
Garage was later destroyed by next doors demolition company which damaged the tenants car and items stored inside (units were being built next door).
We were left without a garage for over a year while it was rebuilt with no rent reduction and yard fence along the side also damaged and removed exposing our yard for over a month with no security or temporary fence.
Reticulation always breaking down and was reported to pm who didn't do anything about it and lawns died even with hand watering 2-3 times per week which we were breached for. We seeded the lawn and fertilised at our expense.
Had several water leaks for months which were instantly reported and not fixed until water was pouring. Tried to pin $1,300+ bill for the leak on tenants even though we fulfilled our responsibility of reporting it.
Didn't have hot water until we threatened to call our own plumber and send bill to real estate to pay after waiting for 1-2 weeks.
House is infested with ants inside and outside. Killed plants in the garden beds. Ate through the grout in kitchen, bathroom and floors in laundry/toilet. 
All windows in house either have broken rusted flyscreens or none at all meaning there was always flies, bugs, spiders and mosquitoes inside at all times.
Security screen doors not secure. Locks were dodgy and didn't work properly but were never fixed, we replaced front door lock/handle at our own cost as it broke off when we tried to open the screen door.
All gates were broken down, rusted and falling apart and at least 50 years old (as old as the property) and exposed the yard so you don't have any privacy and also couldn't lock any gates. There's now a new front gate that was only installed as the demolition ruined the old gate.
Rent went up $130 after notice to vacate, with minimal maintenance done (1x light changed, mould painted over in a few rooms).

In the Melb hail storm of Jan 2020, rain pissed through the lights, destroyed my matress, bedding and carpet. The main bedroom roof buldged under the weight of the water, though it never popped. When the SES arrived to patch the roof they found a tree growing in the gutter. It had been perhaps a decade since the gutters were clean. Water leaked out through lights slowly for a week onto my bed (it's already fkd so why try save it now?). Damage from storm in main bedroom was never repaired. Ceiling was left with this weird curve and started to grow mold. I kept asking for the ceiling to be replaced. I slept on couch in the lounge room for four months. Carpet was 'dried' but stunk and they refused to replace it. Agent stopped taking my calls, ignored my emails. Even after the storm nothing the gutters STILL weren't empited. Oh yeah and there was a hole in the carpet from carpet LICE and rather than patch it they just left the hole there and re rented it out after I left. Charged $580 per week. Agent magically saw my email the day I gave the notice to vacate.

The landlord was absolutely horrible. On our first house inspection she proceeded to open all our cupboards and drawers and look in them. I asked her not to repeatedly, because it's a breach of tenants rights and privacy. After asking 5 times I finally told her I'll be contacting tenants rights victoria and VCAT for breach of tenants rights times she yelled at me “I own this house” and stormed out. The real estate agent witnessed the entire thing and didn't intervene.

She also stored asbestos sheets in the backyard for the duration of our tenancy and didn't tell us what they were until I had a friend at a lab test it for us independently. She argued that it was perfectly safe and then months later two people in full hazmat suits arrived to remove it.

I have both of the above events documented in email. If it's disputed I have receipts.

Mould everywhere - in the walls, inside cupboards, everywhere. Horrible, earthy smell everywhere. Floorboards were cited by an occupational hygienist as set down straight on the dirt. Apartment odour was intolerable and there were known leaks under the floors that the landlord refused to fix.

I terminated the lease and went to NCAT and got compensation. Shameful rental and poor quality property.

Water drips in the ceiling everytime it rains. The ceiling is mouldy & rotting. Part of the ceiling is not attached to the beam. Landlord & Real Estate refuse to fix. There is mouldy silicone in the shower, the shower leaks & water leaks behind the shower water maker water pressure not great. Neighbours smoke on the door step & only way of communicating is to yell at you.

The landlord at the end of the lease was extremely stingy and attempted to have me post for repairs  that were fair wear and tear, had to threaten tribunal to get bond back, then never heard anything. The agent managing was also extremely difficult to work with. 

The apartment was quite noisy (could hear the next door guy cough, open doors, running dryer etc). Upstairs did a renovation and put in wooden floors without acoustic underlay meaning could hear every step.

Ceiling in bedroom significantly damaged following flood events of 2021 SES could not assist us and we had to drill holes in the ceiling to allow water to freely flow through to avoid the ceiling collapsing. Agent advised us she was on a beach holiday. Roofing plumbers attended 9 months later advising a new roof would need to be installed and as the site is owned by developers, this did not occur. Significant mould issues on the ceiling, doors, wardrobe, bathroom and water running down the walls in kitchen whenever it rained. As the site was a demolition site at the time of occupancy we were too afraid to pursue it further. Flooring in the bedroom dangerously loose in areas.
Roof leaked, chemicals present in the property, nosy owners sending their relatives to look, sewage backed up multiple times, faulty gate damaged my car, owners sued us for "damages" but lost.

The flooring in the living room was heavily water-damaged, broken and unsafe to walk on, due to a leaking water pipe in the bathroom leaking through the wall and into the floor. The issue was raised repeatedly over more than a year, including at multiple rental inspections  different agents/property managers. It was never fixed and we eventually left the property with it still unsafe to walk in the living room. The leaking pipe also required removing a large number of bricks from the bathroom wall, and this hole in the wall was left without being fixed for months, and was eventually covered with a piece of chipboard but remained otherwise uninsulated and draughty for the subsequent winters.
The taps in the bathroom sink were reported to be leaking around the clock and a month later, an unqualified member of the family who own the property came around and replaced the taps, but did not fix the leak, which continued until we left the property.
The fixed electric wall heater in the living room was reported to be broken and, despite this breaching minimum standards for rental properties, it was never fixed, and simply replaced with a Bunnings-bought floor heater after it was reported.

Agent/owner refused to do required repairs. Took them to tribunal twice as they issued me with a retaliatory eviction for telling them that I would go to NCAT if they didn't do the repairs. Had no Aircon for 12 months and they only complied with the NCAT orders to replace the AC after I had gotten a certified copy of the orders because they had not complied within the timeframe on the orders

This house has mould in the bathroom above the shower. Suspected mould that has been painted over in the second smaller bedroom. This house has a rat problem as the floorboards are cracked and mouse can enter.

House had a serious mouse infestation that was impossiple to get rid of despite our best efforts, pest control had to be called and returned twice. Landlord didn't take our requests about the mice seriously until we threatened to call pest control ourself. No insulation in the roof or walls so house was freezing in winter and boiling in summar. Thin walls and windows mean you get woken up by the traffic on Wellington street in the morning. Bathroom was weirdly laid out and overall not the best. Kitchen was large and spacious but the oven and stove were old. House in an awesome location with a cool back garden space, however garden got severely overgrown without regular maintenance.

The electricity from the unit is powering a communal laundry. We discovered this some years ago and brought to the attention of the managing agents on multiple occasions either during inspections or in writing. When we informed the the agent that it was our understanding the rental provider may be responsible for paying the electricity for the shared meter, they said they “find it strange this has only been an issue recently and not from the start of your tenancy in 2019”. We then reminded the agent that our tenancy commenced in 2014 and we had raised this when we discovered it, and they were asked to rectify it multiple times. 
So that's nine years and counting that we have been paying the electricity bill for a communal facility at the property.

Overpriced, right next to the main road and with no sound proofing was loud from traffic, land lord reacted weeks late or not at all about mouse infestation, water leaking through windows during heavy rain, or a collapsing ceiling.

House is cheap fibro, built like crap, no insulation, had mushrooms growing through the floor. Landlord owns the eye clinic in front and reports constantly back to the agency as a "concerned neighbor". All the neighbors are cool and defo dont give a shit about a bin being visible. Leaves medical waste in personal bin. Set up a Covid testing facility out front and had sick people walking up and just hanging around outside. Agency are cunts and would white glove inspect quarterly, insisting renter is home midweek. Constant fight over that one. No parking as promised. Gas leaked out of poor fittings. On move out, tried to scam me for over $200 to paint over a mark on the wall.

Overall a solid home that mostly treated us well; except for the waterfall at the back door whenever it rained. We spent 2 years asking them to repair the gutters, and mostly just got stalling tactics. We did lose some possessions to mould, and I had to regularly scrub the walls especially the dining room. When I drove past after we left, there was work happening in the back yard, so might have been fixed now.

We ended up leaving in Jan 2023 because the owner just stopped paying the mortgage repayments and became completely uncontactable by the bank and the estate agent - we were ultimately approached by lawyers representing the bank as part of a mortgage repossession, and it became our legal problem. The bank obviously then wanted to sell, so we went through the whole invasive ordeal of open homes etc etc - only to have the auction cancelled 2 days prior to its planned date. We were told the owner paid out the entire mortgage that day - so I guess this won't be a future problem with this owner, but it was all very weird and kind of shady; not to mention distressing, and really cemented that as a tenant you have basically zero autonomy.

Cupboards falling off and apart, leaking roof, fraying carpets, broken windows, shower head was held up by a piece of string, lifting flooring throughout, just to name a few. The house was generally unsafe to live in despite multiple requests for help when our new baby arrived. We were trying to find somewhere else to go, but the rental crisis made it near impossible. The worst part is I'm pretty sure the landlord had to fix all the issues when we left in order to rent it again. Why couldn't they have just helped us when we were there if they were going to fix it anyway? It was truly a horrible time. We sent many emails asking for help and the agency barely took the time to even spell my name correctly. One time, on the phone when I was explaining how it wasn't safe for my baby, she said we should live in an AirBnb!?!? Who on earth could afford that, let alone a young family just starting out!? The agency were so rude, even if it was the landlord ultimately making the calls too. (No need to feel bad for us either, by the way - We now live in a wonderful rental with a great landlord and agency and have had 0 issues since!)

Landlord lives next door (realestate lied when asked directly prior to signing lease), there is zero insulation or air-conditioning making the house unlivable for parts of summer and there was mold when I lived there

Disgusting, run down, no maintenance. Filled to the brink with cockroach infestation. 

The realestate did an inspection without an entry notice, and all sorts of other illegal actions.

Whole building hates this agency. Apartment itself was fine, but the building was advertised as secure, parcels kept getting stolen from the lobby, agency did nothing to help so tenants grouped together and filed a police report. Turned out the gate at the back of the building was completely without a lock built into it and people could come through into the lobby from that back gate.
One tenant exposed them for this, put up a flier in the common areas saying the agency have known about this for ages and won't do anything.
Agency REPLIED with their own printed note that read to the effect of tough tits; if we didn't want our parcels stolen, try getting them delivered to the post office.

This is a Queenslander that's been sub-divided into smaller units so the landlord can get more bang for their back. What they don't tell you is that the landlord lives on the property too. The walls are also paper thin so you'll hear everything from your three other neighbours. Kitchen was right next to my bedroom wall so I could literally hear them chopping their vegetables each night. Literally no privacy. When I used to live there, there was no air-con and the ceiling fans barely worked and mainly just moved hot air around. Absolutely boiling in summer. Completely unlivable.

This place was really lovely to live in. Quiet street, quiet neighbours and backs onto a gorgeous park. The real estate agent was lovely too. The place was kept in good condition so we barely even needed maintenance -- I actually don't think we once had a single maintenance request while living there for the whole 3 years that we did. Pet friendly too which is also lovely! Close to shops, close to public transport. Inspections were in line with the lease and done professionally by the agent. Honestly one of the best places and stress-free living experiences I've ever had.

Derelict house should be demolished. Drafty, dirty, moldy and has asbestos.  Owner doesn't want to fix anything, but at least doesn't get too pissy about exit condition. Has had a paint job and minor repairs plus actual window treatments since I moved out (had torn rags hanging from nails previously) but I'd still be dubious.

I lived in the property for years and there was an ongoing mould issue. It's built on swampy land and you have to keep under floor fans running 24/7 (as per owners instruction, but with no compensation for electricity bill from owner). The property also has very poor ventilation and mould will build up quite quickly in the ensuite, primary bedroom and primary wardrobe. It's a townhouse and so it has an ajoining wall to the property next door, which has been unoccupied for more than 3.5 years at this point (there are plants growing up through the floor boards next door which you can see clearly through the window). Because the vacant property next door has not had under floor fans running to prevent damp the ajoining wall has internal mould which shows up as yellow stains on the wall. Cleaners that have come to the property have told me this is a structural issue and there is nothing I could do about it. Despite the fact I ran multiple dehumidifiers mould would always return, it made my ex partner and I extremely lethargic and sick all the time (we didn't realise the mould issue was as extensive as it was until we were moving out of the property). On top of this the rental agency are very slow to respond to all requests or simply don't respond at all (for example I waited 2 weeks for them to organise hard rubbish pickup to remove old furniture, because in a townhouse block the owners corp must do it, but it was never organised so I had to pay for it personally).

From day one I discovered all sorts of issues, flooded and mouldy storage cage, mouldy apartment, poorly maintained and incredibly dirty. The agents couldnt care less and are well aware of the mould issue.
Hole through the back of gas oven, inside of cupboards mouldy, cupboards unusable, mould throughout the house. Broken clothesline (held together by rock and tape).

When we moved in one bedroom had massive salt built up on wall which was painted over and a hole was drilled into wall to outside to help reduce build up, we didn't know much better and thought this seemed fine. Door frames were deteriorating, lighting always had issues and the electricity was a bit wierd, roof ALWAYS leaking. This was a nightmare how badly it leaked especially in one spot that caused permanent damage to floor boards and repairs took so so long for this. I can't remember if it was ever properly fixed but whenever it rained we had to put a towel or bucket down. 

The property was so unbelievably cold at all times and the bathroom had mould- I suspect a leak near the 'sky light', a 'sky light' with damaged wood around it so you could see outside at times. The back window frames by the garden are in places just rotted. The neighbour is a nightmare and will tell you regularly about her opinion on your gardening, how long your laundry has been up and if the trees are too tall. She was truly a nightmare to live next to and was the icing on the cake of this awful property. The kitchen light stopped working entirely, the oven didn't work properly (only on like a grill setting?). I can't believe this property continued to be leased after we moved out and I really hope  repairs were done before it was leased to anyone else

The landlord owns the entire block of units and would come around frequently. They used the property as a personal storage facility. I caught them looking into my bedroom window when they thought I wasn't home once. Their son (a grown man) was intoxicated and singing in the back yard in the middle of the night one evening. He blamed one of the other tenant's 'greasy foreign food' for the poor plumbing in the building. There was actually poor plumbing due to tree roots. When I complained and it was eventually fixed I was branded a troublesome tenant. 

I was always consistent with rent. The agent was mostly ok, though would arrange dodgy repairs, e.g., a cheap hot water system replacement that was not energy efficient and which was installed incorrectly, and failed a week after the install. 

I wouldn't recommend this address or agent based on my experience.

The Landlord lives next door, uses your bins, drops in whenever, gets his dodgy repair dudes to 'fix' issues, many issues with water leaks, mould and water damage including white powder permeating through the brickwork and discoloured carpets in wardrobes, flies come through the ceiling, massive hole in garage due to water (wasn't fixed, stayed a year with many visits from him and his blokes), shit build with stuff breaking all the time, tiny backyard that backs onto a noisy childcare centre, did put an AC in the bedroom for us but it gets damn hot ebrywhere else and only ac is in bedroom, no insulation, LL removed bricks from the exterior and left a snake sized hole under the GAS heater, bricks were still removed after 1 yr, LL stored and old water heater in the garage, carpets from the 90s, shit oven, can't cook roast veg even, mould on kitchen sink ( had a sorry looking bloke selleys over the top of the mould at LL request), got a weird anonymous letter in the post from previous tennant warning us not to leave anything valuable in the garage as they had their motorbike stolen, got stung $800 to replace frayed 90s carpet!, paint, and for keys we never recieved. NB: the agent tried to help and I don't really blame them. But, be warned, there are 5 units at 36 The Grove and they all have the same issues and LL. We actually had a whatsapp group to share our LL experiences lol.

The house was old but would have been gorgeous in its day.  I was told after we moved in that the owner wasn't going to put any money in to the house because they were just waiting for land value to rise and then they were going to sell it for development. 

When it rained,  we had indoor and out door waterfalls,  and I couldn't vacuum the carpet properly because every time I did,  the mould that was holding the carpet together would disintegrate and big chunks of the carpet would come up.  I had to stick the carpet patches with packing tape to hold it together.  

There was no range in the kitchen and the toilets would get blocked all the time.  

The agent kept all my bond to replace the carpets,  which I had complained about and sent photos of all the mould.

Lived here for almost 3 years, and the rent increased each renewal with no renovations and minimal repairs conducted. We thought the house was great initially, a little bit old, carpets were shit, but it seemed fine. Cracks started appearing all through the inside of the house, we had issues with ants, the back fence started collapsing and the side gate was rotted and didn't close properly. Then the rain happened and we had leaks in the garage. The ceiling looked like a pillowed quilt case and swelled more each time it rained. The patched and painted over the top because there was "no leaks" in the roof. My allergies got bad and we thought it was pollen and dust, but later found out that the house had a historical mould problem and they just bleached and painted over it. We had torrential rain and flooding at the start of 2022 and that caused walls to become water damaged, multiple roof leaks and an explosion of mould so bad that it destroyed 2/3 of everything we owned. I even got electrocuted by the house which tripped the circuit breaker due to the moisture in the walls. The mould was growing on glass and stainless steel, and was every colour you'd imagine. We didn't have contents insurance because we couldn't afford it. Our neighbours helped us pull everything out of the house and load trailers full of mould damaged belongings, and let us couch surf. The landlord and real estate, despite showing evidence, noted that there was no mould, there never was any mould, and we just wanted to break lease in the middle of a housing crisis because it was "easier". Since we left, they ripped up the carpets, threw away the blinds, installed aircon, renovated the bathrooms and kitchen partially, replaced ceilings and cut out sections of walls, and just painted over the rest. The entire roof cavity was full of mould and they thought this would work. You could see the mould growing on the roof tiles from the neighbours house and on the eaves. They upped the rent from $560 to $885, and within 6 months we got a photo sent to us by the neighbours that the whole roof was being ripped off and replaced because the mould issue had continued and was making the young family living there sick. It's really such a shame the landlord is such a bastard because the house was in a great location and the neighbours were wonderful. We were offered no assistance or compensation.

Owner refused to do repairs and refused rent reduction due to unusable areas of the home. I chose to move out as there was zero action on owners behalf to fix the home and full rent was still expected.

We picked the house because it was a huge, beautiful Californian bungalow at an affordable price in a leafy suburb. But wow there were so many issues that the real estate agent wound woefully ignore.
Multiple gas leaks that instead of being fixed, just had the gas turned off. Constant damp and moisture issues that eventually rendered the granny flat at the back of the house uninhabitable. No blinds or curtain coverings for the large (single glazed and drafty) windows. Central heating stopped working halfway through our tenancy. We were asked to move out at the end of 12 months (so that the landlord could demolish) only to have the house listed for rent immediately. We found mould had grown on the carpet underneath our furniture and my mattress and bed slats had to be thrown out. Traumatising. 
2 stars because it was so spacious and had a gorgeous garden.

On inspection we were told  not to mind how grubby the house was because it would be professionally cleaned. When we moved in it was the same.   Everything was old and dirty. The house is subject to mould. The blinds are falling apart and subject to mould. The lights are on ceiling fans that won't be replaced if they break. The doors scrape,the locks are loose,  and the back door is almost run through the bottom track.  The stove in the rear part of the house is so old i had to pay a professional to come and show me how to use it. The owners own plumber had advised that it was broken and would have to be replaced.  The landlord wants access at the drop of a hat. We gave access to tree loppers, surveyors, core drillers.
When we moved in we had to have the place sprayed 3 times to get rid of the roaches. We were notified twice that the water was going to be disconnected because the rates weren't paid.  The owner made direct contact with me on several occasions making payment demands for things that were not my responsibility. We were given notice to terminate twice  and the first time asked to stay , The house was handed over clean and  the rent went up  $130 dollars a week.  It's open for inspection and available now. We remained  in advance on our rent the entire time of our tenancy and we left the place cleaner than we received it.   There is no law against greed there is only Karma.
Bad wiring, poor maintenance, caravans, gaps in the floor, landlord is nosey and shows up for no reason and does nothing useful, 2 bedroom house with 3 rented rooms and two caravans attached

The location was good but once we moved in we realised an few small things like the hot water sys was very small and water pressure wasn't great. the hot water in shower was very low.

Overtime we noticed more issues like the water quality was pretty bad to the point if the toilet tap was fully open it would whistle. 

We also noticed the there was a crack in a window that was close for a while over winter. and also the screens on windows over the balcony were welded in so could not be removed and cleaned.

Then one day arrive home from taking spouse to work one of the neighbours in the next unit let us know there was people coming to check the build for structural issues. That was concering in itself.

A few months before we left We got forwarded notification form the Body Corporate sayign a plumber was coming to inspect 'All units' to quote on replacing the plumbing for tthe building and we had to be home or leave the key with a neighbour so they could have access. On the day I di notice a plumber at about 8:30 but after a few hours I of having no one coming to the unit and notice that Plumber had left I caled the plumber's number on the notification to find out he looked at 2 units then left. This really annoyed me as I had a work mid year party on that day. The plumbing really needs to be replaced but the build is brick and concrete which would make the task very hard.

Finally it was discover the hot water system leaking into downstiars apartment which was very concerning for the structural integrity of the build.

We glad we have left

Took the place out of pure desperation & lived like a vampire for 32 months 🧛 when I move out I was informed the property is not up to code to to its complete lack of natural light & was labelled As 'uninhabitable'. It's a two-bedroom tiny apartment. None of the bedrooms have windows. There is NO STORAGE in the kitchen at all or bench space. NONE. As you are underground, you get no phone service so to take calls the internet needs to be connected so you can do Wi-Fi calling. This place is SO DARK that with the power off, in the middle of a sunny day, you can't see your hand in front of your face in the laundry, bathroom, Hall, or either bedroom. As the only bit of natural like is the 7.5 cm you get above the giant wall I look directly out onto. Property also had a mouse problem which the agent (we're GREAT! My original PM Gabby was wonderful - HOWEVER, they sold the rent roll to Besser & Co who were UTTERLY USELESS & rude.) refused to do anything about. I had spend $250 on 'harm-free' traps. But they were not working. So I had to use the normal traps and having been vegetarian for 35 that was just really distressing. The property had a damp issue & always smelt 'weird'.
HUGE PROBLEM - the laundry were measured incorrectly, so only 3 brands of crappy Chinese top loader washing machine. So try to buy one from the tenant leaving. No dryer will fit. 

Besser & Co are USELESS. Took them 6 months to repair the lock on my door THAT WLULDNT LOCK. So my property was not secure for 6 months. They just ignore you.

I filmed the property when I left. Showed a mate who informed me it wasn't remotely up to code to be rented out as a home. Whoever moves in can break lease at any time or that the landlord to VCAT for compensation for being made to live in an 'uninhabitable property* I was going to use my bond as last rent as I was given NTV so the owner could repaint & red-carpet to rent it out at a higher rate. Was EXACTLY the shove I needed to get the fuck outta there!!! It was so dark with no natural light, I honestly had no clue if it was sunshine or raining. We called it the bunker. Living there messed with my mental health for sure, but also my physical health due to whatever is causing that dampness. I was sick CONSTANTLY there. 
I have a video shot the day I left. Shot a midday on a sunny day with the power off.

Great location. Building manager is very nosey, but if on side will go out of his way to help you.

After 6 months here the floor of the whole house started sinking, starting in the kitchen and eventually every room had a crack at the base between the floor and the wall, 2 inches in some spots. We notified the agency multiple times, and they sent out a tradie who told us that the whole foundation of the house was shifting and collapsing, and it would literally need to be rebuilt. After following up a few times, it became clear they weren't going to fix it or offer any solution. When we moved out, there was also a developing mould problem in all of the walls because of this gap. We know for a fact that people keep moving in and out as we live a few minutes away now - definitely no building or fixing. It must just be getting worse!

Was a grand old house with horrendous mould problem. The back bedroom room would flood every time it rained. Repairs made with duct tape and lots of leaks. Absolutely freezing in winter even with heating. Possum infestation in the ceiling. Landlord refused to address any issues, owned 7 properties in the area and this was the best apparently.
Son was hospitalised with breathing issues.
Agent was awful and told us “if you don't like it leave”. We had 3 small children during lockdown.
Agent was replaced with another who was better. When we gave notice the agent refused to let the property in its current state so the landlord removed all his properties from that real estate and changed to LOVE real estate who let it at $300 more per week.

The upkeep and general maintenance of the property was very problematic. Despite the landlord living in a luxurious home next door, the rental property was in disrepair. We had to call a plumber out every six or so weeks because the toilet wouldn't flush, or the shower was flooding. It was disgustingly dirty when we moved in (we weren't able to inspect before signing the lease because we were moving from a town five hours away) and there was little empathy about the bad condition of the property from the agency and/or landlord.

Constant fire alarms, the rubbish chutes are built terribly and the doors never close so it smells foul always, the downstairs big bins are often locked, there's construction from the new busway and the apartments are terribly built so the toilets dont flush properly.
Holes in walls, general maintenance needed.

German roaches crawling out of the corners of the wall in the kitchen
Mold growing on the exposed brick walls in the bedrooms
Windows not sealed in the bedrooms so they shake in the wind. 
You can hear everything your neighbours are doing and saying
Mosquito's everywhere due to the heavy tree coverage out the front.

Damp and mould under kitchen sink and in bathroom. No TV antenna initially, but one was run out the window which then had to stay open. Constant dodgy repairs and hack jobs. Broken tiles so towel rack wouldn't stay fixed. Fly screen and windows don't seal. Smoke detector fell off the ceiling.

Lived there and absolutely horrible house. It was advertised as having AC, it did not. The owner agreed to put it in after the fact.

 Property was dirty on move in day, agent sent a cleaner. The property is very old, we had a leaking roof, which was later rectified, but prone to additional leaks. Whenever something broke, we got the blame first and had to prove of its bad condition before repairs were done. 

Bathroom was also leaking, the agents hired plumber blamed us, he asked me to squirt water on the shower wall so he could check downstairs, meanwhile he illegally videoed me doing it and then showed the agent and we got a letter saying we would have to pay for the damage. Later another plumber arrived and confirmed it was a pipe leak in the wall. Agent and owner knew but did nothing for 6 months. We had no shower use but continued to use the bath, until water began dripping from the ceiling downstairs. Agent notified and we stopped using it immediately. Water continued to build up (as it was the waste pipe which also takes water from the other bathroom). Large crack appeared in roof and waterfalled literally down onto the downstairs lounge room and poured out, damaging our furniture, soaking the couch, we had to move all furniture around and told the agent and owner to immediately come down to the property.

Around 8 months without a main bathroom and repairs were finally completed. Plumber was dodge and rude, so they got what they paid for!! Owner ultimately sold the property and we moved.
We were mistreaten, agent was horrendous, totally disrespectful of us living there, we regularly had people looking over our fence, going in the back gate, walking up to the front door. They even tried unofficial inspections.

I'd avoid the agent and property if i were you!! It's due to collapse with the dodge plumbing work!

Agent was awesome, and the house was clean on inspection but after a week or so mould started appearing in all wardrobes, agent cleaned a couple of times but it was relentless, mould was everywhere, it was a known issue but nothing you can do as a renter. Lost a ridiculous amount of clothing, shoes, books and furniture. Owner reluctant to give bond back, luckily had loads of photos of damaged items. If I had it over again I would of cut my losses and broken the lease.

The house was beautiful for about one month. Then the ceiling caved in during La Niña and the landlord refused to fix it for 5 months. We broke our lease and within one month the ceiling was 'fixed' and it was rented out with a $150 rent increase. Apparently the previous tenants had also moved our due to water and mould issues.

Rising damp/black mould 
Rats in roof that die and maggots fall from ceiling

This property review is not a poor review on either the real estate or the owner, but I think it's a review on the continued poor treatment of tenants as a whole by society. 
My partner and I were experienced harassment from neighbours during our entire stay. They reported that we were drug dealers, had too many visitors, when we parked our camper out the front of our property and even so far as to report that when our car locked, it beeped too loudly. Just to be clear, I am a 30 year old professional, working in IT and my partner was the local postie. Absolutely not drug dealers and the only people we really had around was family. 
We found out that the neighbours didn't like renters and had driven the last two away with their harassment and had spoken openly about how tenants are beneath them and they only want to live on a street with owners. 
We have moved out and have found out that the new tenants have experienced the same treatment. 
We received calls to the ranger and constant complaints about the most ridiculous things. The owner and the real estate were nothing but kind to us, but unfortunately it made our experience a nightmare at that property. We were paying more rent than any of the people on the street that owned we're paying for their mortgage (all purchased in the 90s basically)

No proper ventilation in bathroom. Every winter mould would spread all over ceiling and bathroom windows.

Even though I did not let a single hair strand go into bath drain, it frequently got blocked. I put the drain guard in the bath to prevent any hair from going through, but still the bath was blocked frequently.

Same for the kitchen no duct or ventilation or exhaust exit. Had a very bad stove. The typical white one. I think its been replaced with a new one, however still no ventilation or exhaust. Kitchen drain would frequently get blocked despite the fact I did not let any food particle go through.

The ceiling walls are so thin that I could literally feel and hear when someone was walking upstairs. The floors would vibrate if someone started doing excercise above.

The apartment has been renovated to give a false impression of a nice place, however the underlying issues about drain blockage, thing walls would still be there. Especially the mould issue.

You can also hear the sound of urination from the above flat.

It was unliveable due to mould throughout the whole house. The bedroom wardrobe was full of mould, second bedroom had mould coming through the walls, the lounge room had water stains coming through the roof, dining room has black mould growing from the floor to ceiling on either side of the fireplace (which the owner painted over with normal paint and thought it would fix) the storage room made everything we own go mouldy and the whole room was covered in mould. The bathroom always smells like sewerage. Then outside the bathroom again, mouldy on the entire roof and the granny flat roof was going to fall down! They told us AFTER we requested to end out lease early that we were never meant to use the granny flat (which they advertised as a workshop and home office space) and it wasn't meant to be on the plans as it's dangerous!! So beware if you are using it! Also mouldy in there too! Add all the broken windows that don't open and cracked glass and the weird shower that you can't have a curtain because the railing is too far away, so the whole room gets wet every time you use it. Avoid avoid avoid!!
Plus nosy rude neighbours who think they own the street and came to abuse me while I was pregnant. They accused us of complaining to council about their dog (we didn't) and came to my door a number of times complaining of noise while smoking cigarettes and drinking their can of Jim beam. Meanwhile they would blast metal music all day. Bizarre people so happy we are gone and would NEVER rent in that whole street again!

Property was overrun with mould, made worse by a hole in the roof that wasn't ever fixed letting water into the walls during the heavy January 2022 rain. 
By July 2022 nothing had been fixed, despite our weekly emails with photo evidence of property damages and new growths of black mould. We eventually tried to negotiate a rent reduction (with backpay) and they replied with a lowball offer with the condition that we shut up about asking for repairs in the future. 
We held our ground and threatened to go to NCAT and the next day we were told to vacate in 14 days as the property was suddenly deemed "uninhabitable". (they did end up paying us the backpay that we were asking for and we got 2 weeks of reduced rent)
The property went back on the market 10 months later with old photos on the listing and $100/week more in rent.

Really old and poorly maintained. Cold in winter, hot in summer. Window frames cracking and heaps of gaps. Kitchen cabinets were falling off the walls, the oven door had issues. Issues with bond when we moved out.

Reported multiple issues of black mould, first and second time was told to "just buy exit mould" - when this was clearly a rising damp problem. This eventually led to slugs, as well as affecting my asthma to the point I had to attend RPA. 

A handyman was sent around by the landlord who stripped off the crumbling wall and re-plastered it, but never painted it. Within 3 days - the black mould was back again. Agent said on two occasions they would get someone out to look at it and never did. 

Ended up providing notice of ending the lease and leaving, last I heard (from the upstairs neighbour) the toilet in the bathroom exploded 2 weeks after us leaving. The young son from Gerard Partners was also not a pleasant man to deal with - verbally abusing me on the phone in the middle of the workday when he could not find the keys for a viewing (they were still wanting to rent out the house in the current condition which was uninhabitable).

The house was fine to live in. This rating comes from an absolutely horrible experience I had with the landlord, her daughter and also the agency at that time. The landlord like to do all the repairs herself. One morning, our toilet was blocked. My housemate unblocked it with a plunger, but we started to smell something bad. We went outside and the pipe next to the bathroom had burst and there was shit running down the side of the house, into the backyard and underneath the neighbours fence. I thought, surely this classifies as an urgent repair. I call the real estate urgent repair line, the person I speak to says that does sound urgent, we will send someone straight away. We don't hear anything for hours. Later that day my real estate emails me about something else, I reply and say I spoke to urgent repair line this morning and they were supposed to send someone. She replies saying the landlord wants to take a look. I say ok. When the landlord comes around I am not home. The next morning, the real estate agent sends an email saying the landlord has organised a plumber for Friday. It is Tuesday morning. I say - I thought this classified as urgent and needed to be fixed in 24-48 hours? She says yes but the landlord apparently can't find a plumber. My housemates and I are concerned because there is sewage running under the neighbours fence and we can't open the windows on that side of the house because it smells of shit. I do some research and find that if your landlord doesn't organise an urgent repair you are entitled to organise someone to do it, and they have to reimburse you. On Wednesday I think I am going to get a plumber. The first two plumbers I speak to are available. I let the real estate agent know that I've organised a plumber for that afternoon, and she says the landlord wants to be there. The landlord turns up and the first thing she says is “if this plumber is 1 cent over the quote I have from my plumber for Friday you are paying for it”. I say that's not how it works. The plumber rocks up and takes a look and says this is definitely an urgent repair. He gives his quote which is about $100 over her quote. She turns to me and says u will need to pay that. At that point a random lady who I have never met before storms into the backyard, walks straight past me and without looking at me in the eyes says “get out of my way”. I am extremely confused and I think she must be from the real estate  agent because she is wearing corporate clothes. She walks around the side of the house and SCREAMS at the plumber “you are not authorised to be here”. And I say “excuse me I am the tenant and I authorised him to be here and I am entitled to because this is an urgent repair”. And she turns to me and screams “I am your landlord and you are going to get evicted”. And I say “you are not my landlord your name isn't on my lease and I don't know who you are”. And then she just keeps screaming “you'll see you are going to get evicted” and she keeps screaming at the plumber to get off the property. I am so shocked I go inside the house and start crying. She continues screaming at the plumber in the backyard and then out the front of the house. Eventually they all leave. The plumber calls me and asks if I'm alright and he says that situation was not ok, and he also asks for my real estate agents number so he can report what happened to them. The pipe isn't fixed until Friday. In addition, we overpaid our last rent cycle because the real estate agent messed up our documents up. They agreed that we overpaid rent and they request the landlord the landlord to pay it back, and the landlord never returns it. The real estate say they can't do anything. When we move out I seek compensation from VCAT for the overpaid rent, the landlord makes a counter claim for the exact same amount that we have claimed - for the purpose of their plumber coming to fix the toilet because they found toilet paper blocking the pipe!!!!!!! So we have had our bond withheld and are still owed overpaid rent and it has been nearly three years. I hated this experience and am still shocked at the daughter. I do not recommend this person as a landlord, and in addition I found the real estate agent extremely unhelpful.

On face value it's gorgeous but the house is sinking so when you walk in and you can see the tip. The roof in the kitchen rains when it rains outside causing black mould, the posts that hold up the back porch are rotted through, the fan in the main bedroom sounds like a percussion band (but the owner says it's “structural”), the entire under of the house where the laundry is is fully mud that is mouldy & smells of urine. I layed some rocks in one part for my dog & had to pour my own concrete slab to have my washing machine not sit in the mud. The ensuite bath has floorboard rotting underneath and you can feel it starting to give way (on a stilted home) so would be a 2m drop. The ensuite structure is tipping forward due to sinking. The backyard is full of potholes and cane toads. When the bedroom door handle broke off leaving us unable to close the bedroom, she wouldn't fix it so we had to do this ourselves, front stairs are rotted through & reported by every maintenance team that came out. The roof is full of pigeons and they nest under the house where the laundry is. Property as a whole is not maintained at all. 
The owner fixes NOTHING & the real estate takes months to respond. 
My dog kept escaping the yard because the 25m long wire fence wasn't secured to the ground properly. I offered to go thirds to help pay for a new fence with the owner & neighbours to which she ignored me. 
I spent hundreds on a trying to secure it and building a side gate, had someone connect electricity to the ensuite because she said it wasn't possible and invested a lot of time & money to improving the house to liveable but it got too much. 
After fixing nothing she still upped the rent by $30 a week to renew which I agreed to because I needed the house but after a few more months I issued them a notice of breach to which they let it lapse, I moved and now they rented it out again for $40 more a week.

This house has potential to be a really lovely family home with some cool little quirks. However - repairs are not done or if urgent are usually done by a 'handyman' who claims not to understand or speak English and who does the cheapest fix possible, often causing further issues. For example a glass door pane was broken when we moved in. We had small children and had to barricade the door from them; it wasn't fixed in 4 years. The pool had a tear in the bottom and we ended up doing a temp fix that won't hold for long and will once again cause a lot of water to drain from the pool - expensive to keep refilling, which you need to do because you need to keep the pool in good repair and an empty pool can pop out of the ground and break. The newer, renovated half of the house has come apart from the older part of the house, causing a leak from the roof and subsequent mould in the ceiling. This has been temp fixed a couple of times but still leaks. The mould spread and it became impossible to remove it from the bathroom as well as the ceiling. There was also an unreasonable level of noise from the construction happening on 3 sides of the property. On either side houses were / are being demolished and new ones built, which is part of living in suburbia but good to be aware of. Across the street water corp are doing wastewater upgrades which involves heavy (I'm talking house shaking, brick dust coming down the inside of the walls, windows rattling) construction, 6 days a week from 7am to 7pm and now night works as well due to them being behind schedule. It is incessant with giant drills going into the earth, huge trucks coming and going constantly, and general construction noise as well as a lot of dust and occasional sewerage smells. This was going on from start of July and would apparently 'ramp up' over the Christmas period and continue until March 2024 at the earliest.
The property manager at this property changed over about 6 times in the 4 years we were there. They messed up inspection times, didn't seem to know what was going on, miscommunicated constantly and were hard to get hold of. They were really unhelpful and unconcerned about the level of discomfort from the construction. The ad when we left felt like a bit of a dig as it described the property as 'tranquil', 'peaceful' and 'quiet' even though they knew our main reason for leaving was the incessant noise, dust, and sewerage smells. 
If the house was maintained it would be a lovely place to live (once the construction is all settled down!)

Mould trap. Had mould growing up the walls and caking the windows. Windows not sealed properly. There is a building fault and water seeps into the cupboards and my roommates clothes went mouldy. Our furniture went mouldy. Real Estate told me that they hadn't had a problem with mould before.
