The previous tenant worked at the pub next door and shared screenshots of their own problems with the property, with the same real estate agent i was speaking to. Sent those back to the real estate and after months of bandaid solutions they sent out a mould doctor who confirmed that yes, it was mould. Got out of my lease a month early by breaching them. It's been two weeks since I left and they've relisted the property for $50 more than what I paid. The pictures in the listing are not of the unit, they are of the neighbours. The neighbour also has mould growing on their ceiling. DO NOT RENT HERE UNLESS YOU LONG FOR MOULD.

House is covered in black mould. Lever windows with some panels missing. Rotting house supports. Missing Lino. Doors can't be unlocked from outside with key. No outside lights. Drainage issues. Flyscreens dirty, torn and barely attached to windows. Front screen door doesn't close. Single 1m cupboard in kitchen. No cupboards anywhere else in house. Shed has no door. Plasterboard on outside walls are broken or missing. Eaves missing, allowing animals in roof. 4 power outlets in whole house. Carport very unstable. No laundry or place to put a washing machine. Rotting front steps and back ramp. Resident turkeys that will jump on car and peck at it. No secure yard.

This rental is a unit that was converted from a doctors office (but I honestly think it's just a former garden shed) and was not build for a human being to live in there. It is located in an alpine spot and has no insulation. Never in my life have I paid more expensive heating bills, and the moment I'd turn off the heating, it would drop to whatever temperature it was outside. In the summer, it was like living in a greenhouse, in winter - a morgue. There was a recurring mould problem that the landlord refused to fix. I had to pay for my own mould removal in the end after being so sick from it that I had to stay at my parents house for a few months. As well as this, the landlord had no respect for my privacy. In one instance she had come onto the property unannounced to confront me. Her and the property manager had regularly bullied me when I had submitted repair requests to the point where I had no intention to ask for things that needed fixing including a very flimsy lock on the door that would absolutely not stopped anyone who wished to break in. The house was in such poor condition, repairs were needed regularly. I am astonished I got my bond back in the end. I wouldn't wish this kind of living condition on my worst enemy. It was truely atrocious and I am so lucky I had the resources to fall back on like being relatively close to my parents home, but for someone who doesn't, it would have been horrific.  This rental was it's own circle of hell.
Owner would never repair anything and was a prick, yelled at me in the street after we moved out

A tree is literally growing through the floor and roof making the house unstable and leading to constant leaks. The bathroom is rotting and mouldy, kitchen benches are rotting. There is no air con and only 3 windows in the house are functioning. Cold in winter , a furnace in summer due to no insulation and shitty heating system. 
Back room is asbestos. Yay.

I had roof rats which the agency blamed me for. I had to pay the exterminator to see to it despite there being multiple entry points for them. The rats would scratch at the walls at night behind my bed. The floor boards had holes and there was no insulation in the floor so it would be freezing in winter and so hot in summer. Ants would come through the floorboards.

we had to deal w repairs n sh1t the whole lease, landlord and her son coming round to “fix” things over n over again meanwhile the place is infested with mould (and also cockroaches while we're at it ay) and we've been told there's “somethibg deeply wrong with the property” by tradies LOL. i could go on. just don't rent. we got the property switched over so that it's managed by the real estate rather than the owner- JUST AS SH1T

Leased the property for 12 months, broke lease 9 months in due to not meeting rental standards per tenancy legislations for Tasmania. Constant mould problems, inadequate heating (fireplace was deemed a hazard by a professionalhowever realestatetold us it was fine), unusuable oven provided at start of tenancy (was told we just needed to clean it however it should have already been cleaned considering we had just moved in), the bathroom had windows that could not be opened and a broken exhaust fan so the roof was wet from using the shower for hours after, was often so cold you would lay in bed and the bed would be damp and breath was visible during winter. 
We simply asked for repairs to be completed and for minimum standards to be met, and they told us to move out within 28 days but did provide a full bond return. Found out that all the landlords did was lay down some carpet and rerent the property out a couple of months later at a higher cost.

Many other arguments and issues occurred regarding the landlords with this property also however notes are the most important part.

It is an old Victorian house split in 3 units. We lived in unit 1 the biggest one and it is a mould trap. It has rising damp, water penetration in every window and roof. Mould growing everywhere. It is freezing cold in winter no way to heat that place up it was like sleeping outside, and it is hot in summer. Landlord is the agency, and they don't care, they have not fixed anything. We took them to the NCAT and all they did was break our lease and compensate us 500dls. We were sick all the time being there from the mould, and I just saw they recently raised the price. It is a fucking scam and a danger to people's health to rent that place out.

Home is now maintained by landlord, is on a lean, floor boards and splitting to where u can see downstairs. Under the house and the backyard flood every time there's a rainfall more then 5ml. Agency has a power trip.

The whole house has been renovated by the landlord. They bought the cheapest items possible from bunnings. As a result you can only fit a tiny fridge, all the fixtures are low quality, the lighting is mismatched, and during my tenancy, the (2nd floor) bathroom developed a leak (into the 1st floor living room). We showered using a house in the backyard for two months. The landlord did not offer reduced rent for this inconvenience.

The house was renovated previously in such a shit way that holes were left all throughout the house, where rats could get in. Water pressure was horrible and barely enough hot water. The oven doesn't even fit the oven hole which then leaves another gap that rats get into the house through. There is an aspestos fence next to the shed

The house was renovated previously in such a shit way that holes were left all throughout the house, where rats could get in. Water pressure was horrible and barely enough hot water. The oven doesn't even fit the oven hole which then leaves another gap that rats get into the house through. There is an aspestos fence next to the shed

Very much not shit. We rented here for a year while rebuilding our home damaged in a storm. Chandler & the landlord responded to issues really quickly, including one late Saturday night callout involving a blocked sewer. 80's construction house in good condition, FTTN but 100mbps, heating works well but will cost you a mint in gas bills especially as it's a huge house. Note that the air-con is evaporative, so pretty ordinary during a humid summer. Appliances all work well, and for us the rental cost included a gardener, which was a good thing given the size of the garden.

This was a fair few years ago but it's worth flagging for other people to know. They refused to give us keys to our garage roller door when we moved in and we were actually robbed because the burglars were able to get through the roller door and then break our window. They tried to take most of our bond for what VCAT ruled to be normal wear and tear - we got our whole bond back and the tribunal member threw out their case. When we were moving out the neighbours told us that the owner is a lawyer and seems to like taking his tenants bonds without good reason.

Lovely location that almost makes up for decades of neglect, bullying landlord, a property agent that enabled him and a string of no fault evictions.

Landlord owns all 8 properties in this dilapidated building and is clearly waiting for a developer to offer him a knock down rebuild. Gets by on minimum maintenance - broken or leaky windows, mould damage, broken oven, surcharging sewer pits at the main entrance to the building and electrical arcing fires at the building's connection to ausgrid.

Landlord proceeded to raise the rent on all tenants in the building, provided 6 month leases then no fault evicted 4 tenants for "renovations" where they did the landlord special and painted over everything before relisting for a second rent increase. Property agent outwardly admitted (off the record of course) that they wanted to raise the rent, but legally couldn't so were forced to do no fault evictions.

Unethical behaviour, grubby building and grubbier people managing the place. Stay well clear of it no matter how tempting the location is.

Rising damp, crumbling plaster and bricks, pests, poor weather proofing, black mould, asbestos, no heating, no bathroom
ventilation. see my review of Proactiv Property Management in the shit agents database too.

Property is fine, albeit tiny. Shittest carpets known to man and they will definitely try and make you pay to replace it if you damage it for them to not even bother in the end. The plumbing constantly had problems and clogged all the time, and leaky taps all the time. Owners of other properties also leave their junk in the back of the lot.

Despite photos being true to advertising, the real estate agent told me to not go into the backroom on bottom floor as it was currently being "repaired". It has been confirmed that only one of the bedrooms has a split system, which in the location where the property is gets extremely hot during the summer. There was a smoke alarm in the kitchen, so that's a plus. They were fully aware of the damage under the bathroom sink and there's a literal hole (possibly been cut out deliberately) a cupboard beside it. The agent said that's how it is for the price. Cupboards in both kitchen and bathroom have noticeable damage as well, which the agent is also aware of. There were also a lot of minor issues (slight discolouration on carpets, lack of stove vents, bubling paint on walls and ceilings etc.), but unfortunately that's pretty common in most places in the region according to the realestate agent.

This property is the worst place I've ever lived. It's ground floor of an old red brick apartment block. It was infested with cockroaches. The kitchen is a million years old, stained, dirty, and has no surfaces to prep food on. There was no ventilation in the bathroom which resulted in terrible mould. The complex is prone to rats. The area is a bit dodgy. There's police raids every couple of weeks on the street. There are junkies who walk the streets in the early hours of the morning singing and screaming. The long-term residents who live in the complex aren't good neighbours. Plenty of noise and smoke. The internet connection is in the manhole of an apartment on the top floor, so it's impossible to get issues resolved without entering someone else's property.
Shared laundry and 2 minuet hot water, junkies everywhere and people would use your power to wash their clothes. Please be aware, the place is not suitable for a family

This property would be 5 stars if it wasn't for the agency managing the property. The agency has a seriously incompetent property manager who overcharges tenants by thousands of dollars, lies, and ignores contact from tenants because they're afraid of facing the problems they caused.

The property itself is beautiful. It's unique and stunning. Covered in wood and has high ceilings. The bedrooms are small and super awkward shapes, but the place is so bright and beautiful it didn't matter. The area is perfect. I would've bought this property if it was on the market at the time I was looking.

Lived here in 2020. The building suffered a fire in 2019 that resulted in extensive water damage throughout. As this apartment was on the corner of the building, it had huge swathes of water ingress resulting in mould throughout the walls, ceiling and floors. Both myself and my partner became unwell with black mould poisoning and took the agency to VCAT after they refused to let us out of the lease. The matter was "resolved" before tribunal saw the case (Covid delays meant our case would not be seen for over 18 months). We were eventually able to break the lease, but not before having to dispose of over $5000 worth of furniture and belongings, and paying a $150 cleaning fee on mouldy carpet they still have not replaced 3 years later. The agent harassed us for weeks after we moved until I threatened further legal action.
doesn't meet minimum standards

Where do I start.  One of the bedrooms had no windows to the outside world (instead a window to the 'living room' (if you could call it that), but it did have huge holes in the plasterboard where the mice and rats could come in.  The master bedroom had the window nailed shut.  It was only opened after 9 months of requests.  As this was an upstairs residence summer in that room was deadly, my housemate bunked in with me for most of it. She passed out multiple times that summer due to the heat. When it rained water would trickle down the hallway wall.  Everytime it rained we would notify the real estate agent, and everytime it rained the water bubbles in the wall and ceiling would get bigger.  Eventually there was a particularly bad downpour and the hallway roof partially caved in.  The water poured down the wall, through the floor and into the commercial space downstairs.  Downstairs a young family had rented the space and had just finished renovations.  When this happened there was so much destruction.  So much art work was destroyed.  And there were just about ready to open the doors to the public.  We got out of there immediately.  It was lucky I happened to be there when the roofing plumber inspected it.  He told me the residence 'should be condemned'.  That was our smoking gun and was enough to get us out of our lease.  They deducted $145 from our bond for carpet drying after that incident. In hindsight we should have gone to VCAT but we needed the money.  We assumed they would be taking the time to replace the entire roof before re-leasing (which is what the roof plumber said was required), but no, they had new tenants in there a fortnight later.
1/10 rental
1/10 agency

House had mould, cornices falling down, holes and burnt carpet from cigarettes. Sewerage burst and wasn't repaired properly and the blinds were mouldy and stained they were so old an degraded they were falling apart when washed. Huge amount of termite damage. Shower had bulging tiles and black mould siliconed over with delaminated glass doors. When it rained the carpet in the bedroom would get wet so there was a leak somewhere. At night a terrible earthy smell would burn your nose. 
The garage would also flood.

We lived in this house for about 18 months, during that time it was extremely difficult to get any maintenance done. Our oven was broken for 2 months, the shower constantly clogged, we couldn't use our kitchen sink. We had no emergency numbers provided to us, the only number was an agent who no longer worked at the agency. The landlord would try and fix the issues himself and during one visit had an argument with me as we had lodged a breach with VCAT for the broken oven. We also tried to add a 4th person to the lease (4 bedroom house), and had her denied which ended our tenancy. We broke the lease and the landlord would only accept applications with 3 people on them. We ended up taking them to VCAT as we were paying for a house we weren't living in and they had droves of people applying. Beyond stressful and an awful experience.

The landlord of this property was incompetent at best and will-fully neglectful at worst. Besides the house having multiple issues such as mould, having the balcony rotting away (literally only 1 floorboard left), the oven stopped working roughly 1 month into my tenancy, as the seal had come undone. This also meant that the knobs for the stove melted and were not usable. The landlord then came over himself, wathed a youtube tutorial on his phone, took the door off, and left. We were 5 people living in this house, and had no way to cook. He eventually replaced the stoveknobs, but the oven was never fixed.
The real-estate agent was definitely evil. COVIR hit and we all lost our jobs, and he promised a rent reduction in person, but when we asked for it in writing, he never responded. We asked him multiple times. Additionally, when I asked if I could record our conversation, he got very angry and yelled at me and my housemates, which was highly intimidating(we were all girls in our early twenties, he was a 40+ year old man). Additionally, he dragged his feet with the new lease, so we never actually got a lease (we were on a rolling one from the previous tenants), which made it difficult for us to take him to court. I did a bit of digging into the agent's past, and he had his real-estate license REVOKED for 10 years due to embellishment back in the early 2000's, which I think perfectly explains what kind of person he was. At the end, we left after ~4 months, had to move during COVID lockdown (which was super stressful), and they took almost our entire bond for cleaning, even though we had cleaned everything and had only been living there for a few months. Finally, the landlord also decided to re-paint one of the bedrooms during COVID, which meant that an unknown man came in every day and painted the room, leaving us limited in the space we were able to use during lockdown when people were not allowed to leave the house.

Power sockets hanging out of walls, spray foam insulation falling from the gaps in the down lights, advertised as four bedrooms. One of the bedrooms is tiny and extremely dark. It would not fit a double bed inside comfortably. Another is a converted garage. Fans you wouldn't dare turn on because they wobbled around so much you thought they'd fall on you. No working heating in the house at the time I lived there and the cold leaks in through gaps in window frames and floors. Ran my own electric heater through winter that barely heated my bedroom because the heat would escape. Ended up spending a fortune on electricity. The outside deck is enveloped with vines which we were expected to “maintain”, which involved cutting back the growing tendrils as they threatened to approach the kitchen area. The stove is old and takes a long time to heat up. Not a kitchen for a cook by any means. Stains on the ceiling in the kitchen. 
 Bent up Venetian blinds. Cracked shower screen that would attract mould. Weird foamy tiles in bathroom that attracted mould. Even after scrubbing the bathroom felt dirty. Multiple types of tile on the floors and walls. A generally hideous bathroom. 

Any person who knows their rental rights and has experience in renting for a few years would never tolerate living there. Unfortunately close to Deakin University and was affordable at the time so attracts a lot of first time/inexperienced renters. 

This is just a generally draughty, poorly insulated house filled with old, dysfunctional elements and patchy DIY. If it has remained the same, I do not recommend applying for this property. I can only hope that since living here they have drastically improved the quality of this property.

Very old house with no aircon, had clay pipes for the toilet. Tree branches were growing inside so toilet was blocked, never fixed as too expensive. Hot days, cold nights, an oven about 30 years old, carpet around 50. Rent was cheaper though.

I lived in this property for nine months. Water leaked down from the roof in the kitchen. It leaked inside and the agency said it was due to me leaving the window open when it rained, though then revealed the landlord knew the building had water defects. Moisture caused doorframes to swell so doors couldn't be shut. Mould grew in the walls though I was dismissed it wasn't mould. I left my lease early and on final inspection, landlord attended and told agent they'd paint over the mould. Agent was unresponsive during tenancy, was rude and dismissive

This place looks and seems nice from the outside. Then we moved in…cockroach infestation that we had to pay to eradicate as the landlord refused. Windows don't open, roof leaks, the sunroom windows are sealed with tape, electrical outlets exposing wires, a pipe burst and wasn't fixed for a month meanwhile the water leaked into the wall cavity and caused massive damage, rotting wood beams.

One of the apartments in the building is rented out as public housing and the tenants in there were so awful, I was fearful for my safety at times.  They would have out outside my apartment door and verbally attack me and threaten me when i came home at night. They would often be up until 4 or 5 am with music playing so loudly it would shake my walls. The landlord did  nothing about it. They told me i had to take the tenant to VCAT, they wouldn't even let me break my lease without paying the reletting fees. The building was also in awful condition. The shared laundry was disgusting and was often full of actual rubbish with machines that never worked

I lived there for 9 months.  In that time the door handle fell off the door. 
I figured it's within my rights to ask for a functioning toilet door.
I followed up numerous time.  6 months of asking and it had become time to renew the lease.  They sent through a lease offer including a form 13 which outlined responsibilities of landlords and tenants.  I asked about the section that said landlord must complete reasonable repairs in a reasonable time frame.
I got an email back 2 mins later (literally 2 mins later for an organisation that generally took a week to return an email) saying we retract your lease offer and you will be given notice to leave in a separate email.

Apparently asking for a toilet door is enough to kick out a single parent and 2 kids. Or maybe I got it wrong and they just happened to change their mind and it was a freak coincidence.

Yew! 

I knew people who knew the landlord.  They tell me he's got the cash and made a bunch off crypto in an early run.  It's not like he couldn't afford to do it.
I also offered to do it if they laid expenses.
To be honest I'd say the agency was the real issue.  The senior person there was a dick swinging idiot.

This property came with an oven with a heating element falling off the oven, which we notified the real estate agent during the initial inspection as it is an electrical hazard and were told by the real estate agent is supposed to be that way. The first time we used the grill, the heating element completely fell off. The windows were painted shut. There was a leak in the roof just above the only kitchen counter space and rain would splash onto our dining room table. It was never fixed although we reported it to the real estate agent multiple times. There is a hole in the outer wall on the right side of the house. The house was covered in a thick layer of dust from "renovations" (unsure what renovations were done - the house has original features) but we were expected to clean it when leaving. The house was very damp and mould grew on my belongings. When we moved out due to the leak in the roof, the landlord kept our bond.
Rubbish dumped next door, rat infestation, trashed backyard overgrown, leaking ceiling, black mould, holes in floor.

Black mould in bathroom. Agent told us to shower with the window open (ground floor unit backing onto a parking lot). Heaters do not work. Dishwasher does not work. Toilet seat was cracked. Often does not get hot water. Gas leak smell at front of apartment block. Apartment was not clean upon moving in, upon moving out tenants were made to pay for professional cleaning. Agent did not take action on any issue when alerted multiple times.

- unexpected landlord visits approx once a month - sometimes more 
- all repair work was done by landlords, dads friend who was a 90y/o man who was definitely retired. Nothing was fixed properly.
- no storm water drainage so our property kept flooding neighbours yard 
- property wasn't sealed, there were vines and plants growing through the toilet wall
- the 'sunroom' wasn't properly an indoor room and had multiple leaks when it rained 
- the carpet was disgusting
- the front door wouldn't shut and would be very hard to open. Refusal to instal a fly screen / security door because the house moved to much
- the only air flow was a front door, a front window and a back door
- no ventilation / exhaust in the bathroom or in the kitchen 
- heater was in the back dining room which was tiled and next to the back door which had visible gaps into the backyard (wasn't sealed) so kinda pointless position for a heater

- moved in being told there was heating, found out the gas heater wasn't even connected to the gas line
- had to fight for the entire tenancy and lodged a VCAT application to get an actual heater installed
- landlord came over unannounced to drop off electric heaters
- back room study / 3rd bedroom (tiny) was covered in black mould over the ceiling so we couldn't use it. The ceiling was also warped like it would break at any moment. 
- real estate agent we're great to deal with, landlord was just an asshole
- there was a window and a back door boarded up at the back of the house that joined to the back part of the property that wasn't part of the lease. This was heritage listed and frequently used by the landlord

Asbestos, rotting windows (the bathroom glass fell out one time bc there was no structural integrity), mould on ceiling kept coming back, paint peeling inside and out, entire back extension sloped down as if it was sinking. Bathroom was only half tiled. Kitchen was incredibly dated with a stove to match. The lino flooring woud frequently lift up. The carpet in the lounge room was stained and had to be over 15 years old. The carpet cleaner guy who steam cleaned on our vacate said he didn't understand why the landlord wouldn't just replace it and that the carpet had really just had it. Rats lived in the walls (noticed immediately when we moved in) so would regularly buy ratsak. Damp rid was required in every room and would need replacing each fortnight. Landlord and agent did basically nothing to fix any issues (except fixed one rusted outdoor light and one rotting windowsill after a year of complaining - note that this was not the one that had the glass break). I even had to pay for my own asbestos sampliThe place had a fair few issues. There was asbestos, rotting windows (the bathroom glass fell out one time because there was no structural integrity. It was patched up but rot still existed), mould on ceiling kept coming back, paint peeling inside on the ceilings and outside on the weatherboard, entire back extension sloped down as if it was sinking. Bathroom was only half tiled. Kitchen was dated with a stove to match. The lino flooring would frequently lift up. The carpet in the lounge room was stained and was so old. Rats lived in the walls (noticed immediately when we moved in) so would regularly buy ratsak. The landlord did organise some pest spraying. Damp rid was required in every room and would need replacing frequently. It was a struggle to get the landlord and agent to fix things/would take a really long time. I even had to pay for my own asbestos sampling and was not reimbursed. They also requested us to pull a choko vine (that came from the neighbours house) out of an electrical box that had asbestos-looking (that part was not lab tested) material next to it at the end of the lease. I felt if I didn't do it, I wouldn't get my bond back. The landlord lived next door and would frequently have arguments with her daughter (yikes!). Regarding the agent, they were in my opinion, the most incompetent person I have ever met. There was always an excuse to why they hadn't got back to emails. One time they said we hadn't signed a lease and we had to send it to them and point out that they had also signed it. Also when I went for the bond return, it still had a previous housemate on it despite sending the real estate the updated form and them saying they would make the amendments with the bonds office. One positive thing is that the other neighbours in the street were lovely and it had a great sense of community. Just a shame that this place was neglected.

Paid $680/week for a unit with no room for a dining table and no outdoor area, with rising damp, fly infestation, mould riddled throughout. Agency provided us with one dehumidifier for a 2 bed unit after complaining multiple times about mould over 2 years. They sprayed the mould once and never followed up. No cross ventilation or fan in bathroom/laundry. Pillows would feel wet to touch due to the moisture and we plowed through damprid. Anything leather would be covered in mould, even when in open hallway and skirting boards all covered. Landlord/agency also initially refused to replace mouldy/water damaged bathroom sink cupboard after a pipe burst and when they did, they only replaced the doors, not the mouldy shelving inside. Eventually moved out after 2 years, threw away almost everything we had there and immediately felt better, no more sore throats or lethargy, and the cats actually started the play and run around again. They rented it out after us for $780. 0/10 do not rent.

Mould in Master bedroom, Living, sunroom and dining room ceiling. Mould grows rampant on all the blinds in the front room and blinds in the master bedroom.  We were cleaning it every month and it just wouldn't stay away. 

Bathroom is updated (last 5-10 years) but doesn't feel legit - Mould rapidly grows in all grout lines, and drains from bathroom floor aren't plumbed (it just flows straight under the house). 

House is the coldest house we have lived in in QLD. There is a heater in the living room, but as soon as its turned off, temp would drop at least 5 degrees in as little as 15 mins in winter. 

Landlord drives by the property regularly on his way home for a stickybeak. 

Basic repairs (like a replacement towel rail) were delayed (unsure as to whether or not it was agency or landlord) - and towel rail was just dropped off for us to install. Faulty fences were misaligned or not functional and never repaired during the tenancy.

Popcorn ceiling crumbling, people shooting up heroine in your carport and leaving dirty needles and rubbish. Slater beetles and millipedes infesting the place- they appear out of nowhere even though I'd bug sprayed the entrances. Mould growing in the bathroom because the landlord couldn't do anything about the ventilation. Ceiling dripping yellow when you shower. Took over a year to get a fan, only got one installed because I mentioned minimum rental standards and health hazards. Left after 2 years to another place I can't afford and they asked me to consider staying because they're installing security cameras and gates at the property to help with the drug problem 🤣

The Property Owner is really nice and is also the Building Maintenance person who respects your privacy and doesnt bother you.  The Units are quite small in this building in studio apartment sizes however are in brand new and very good working condition.  There is no insulation in the building so in Winter and Summer it goes from extreme cold to extremely hot (I joked with my work mates that I probably lost a few kgs in weight over the Summer due to it being like a Sauna in my place).  I mentioned this to the Real Estate and they just did not respond at all to this even though it would probably be an easy fix to install insulation. Some or all of the Units are under the National Rental Affordability Scheme (NRAS) which means you have to qualify with an income means test and reapply for your rental every 12 months.  The Real Estate would also renew the Lease every 12 months in line with the NRAS application procedure effectively 'locking you' into a new lease agreement with no 'Break Lease Agreement' available.  This is okay if you do not expect your financial situation to change and are a low income earner and never plan to leave.  When I departed the property even though I had been there a couple of years and a wonderful tenant always paying rent on time and looking after the property, the Real Estate attempted to challenge the Bond refund even though I gave the required 2 weeks notice (due to the no Break Lease Agreement being available scenario). I was able to prove that the Real Estate had not utilised the 2 week notice period to try to locate a new replacement tenant to get my Bond refunded. I also suspected that one of their Agents had entered the premises while I was in the process of leaving/packing and when I was at work as I found wet finger prints on the kitchen pantry cupboards (like someone had washed their hands after using the toilet and then went snooping in my kitchen cupboards), and half flushed toilet paper in the toilet on arriving home from work one day (this is not the only Real Estate I have had this invasive experience with).  The bathroom drains were also blocked on one occasion and the bathroom floor flooded a little bit which I easily fixed with pouring Draino down there, which indicated to me that the pipes had never been regularly maintained like they should be at least in between tenancies. There is a very good modern and new laundry with paid washing and dryer machines for shared tenant use.  It is a very quiet and peaceful building to live in with good tenants so the Real Estate must do very good comprehensive pre screening checks on applicants for tenancy.  Overall I felt thankful to be in such a brand new shiny Unit for the reduced NRAS price, however it became high maintenance for me to clean the really expensive glass doors in the bathroom every week.

any time anything needed to be done the “tradie” would come who was the landlord in disguise. I took them to tribunal because of significant defects and i ended up giving notice and then they tried to keep my bond (which they didn't get)
Mould in the unit which was never addressed or repaired (behind the wall) and was present BEFORE we moved in. 100% a major health hazard!!!!

Mould throughout home. Landlord shows up randomly and calls tenants. When tenants breach Landlord for not fixing mould that was there before moving in, Landlord gets rid of them despite being 8 months pregnant.

Fine during the tenancy, but changed when the owner wanted to move back in. This was fine until in the last month, the owner had multiple tradies coming to the house to quote renovations. It became once or twice per week. 

We looked after the owners elaborate cactus garden. I pruned trees, looked after nature strip and spent most weekends gardening. 

Had the place professionally cleaned and it looked fantastic. Come time to leave, the claim on the bond was ridiculous. Wanted a gardener to come in and hedge bamboo (looked pretty much the same as when we arrived), as well as someone to repair a bathroom fault that I am convinced was badly repaired when we moved in. 

Even wanted us to clean up the owner's excess building materials until we showed them the photos of it when we moved in.

Refused to allow us to fix any issues, and refused to negotiate. Terrible business.

The unit was ok, but suspected rising damp issue, wall behind front door disintegrated from bottom up to about 60cms. Handyman "fixed" and it happened again. Skirting boards had rust coloured deposits and flaked. Paint flakes from walls in areas, all low near floors. 
Rain for more than 24 hours resulted in water coming in through the architraves in kitchen (2 walls), lounge (2 walls) and through minute cracks in some walls.

No entry notices, no repairs, no maintenance, sent criminals to the house, multiple lies, deceitful, unprofessional, disgraceful communication. Aware of the history of the property, dog fighting, meth lab, drug trade, child drowning in dam and swat teams. Dog bones, animal carcasses & syringes appear after heavy rain … truckload of tyres, unsafe electrical and repeated Non compliance from owner over a decade .. deliberately evasive, several names & multiple trusts - no justice, accountability or responsibility as an owner
Poor /no Maintenance

Back room had a leak in the roof for the entire 12 month lease. Obviously was leaking way before we moved in. The ceiling had been painted, but the mould grew back around the paint job while we were there. 
They cut a hole in the roof after 6 months, then left it until the week we were moving out.
Fucking cunts sent emails denying there was a hole in the roof, denied there was a leak in the roof.
They stopped communicating when I sent a video of the big square hole and rain coming through.
The buildings water proofing is deteriorated so the garage fills with water and mould.

Black mould absolutely everywhere, real estate agent blamed it on me and then ignored the issue. Broken windows in the bathroom that I reported and that went unfixed for my whole tenancy. Whole buildings fire alarms went off at least 7 times throughout the tenancy, usually in the middle of the night at 3am, and the fire brigade had to be called to shut off the faulty detector every time. The agency never fixed the issue.

House was freezing and despite ACT law, there was no proper insulation or heating. The real estate agency/landlords were super slow in responding to maintenance requests. The house was really old and had a lot of plumbing issues but they would always send out dodgy tradespeople who did cheap fixes rather than fix the issue properly. Halfway through the tenancy, the landlords changed agency to PRD (now Archer Canberra) who were super rude. They then tried to take all our bond because we apparently caused the corrosion of pipes underneath the house and then accused us of having missed weeks of rent despite me showing rental receipts from the other agency and transaction histories.

Where do I even start … When I first moved in the carpet was filthy. I borrowed a vacuum for the day just in case, but there was no power. And then it took weeks to unpack everything off the floor before I could vacuum, and he then I didn't even have one anymore. When I got the initial electrical inspection just after I moved in the electricians said something about the switchboard was either illegal, or at least less than ideal (two things on the one switch from memory). The mailbox was full of mouldy mail from previous tenants. The grout in the shower was already terrible when I first moved in. Now it's still bad, but trying to clean it made the silicone start coming off, so I stopped because I didn't wanna cause worse damage. The knobs on the stovetop and oven are misaligned, so it's hard to tell what you're even doing. The windows are locked and none of my keys open them (and they keep saying we have to allow adequate ventilation… how???). The overhead fan in the bathroom is basically redundant because the bathroom ALWAYS has condensation running down the place. The connection to what I think is the TV aerial is in the dumbest place known to man, so I didn't even bother connecting it. The hot water doesn't work properly in winter. There's no adequate heating or cooling (only heating is wedged between the wall and bed which can't feasibly be moved anyway, so it's a major safety hazard). Property manager never actually fixes anything unless it's so bad they'd get in serious trouble. They tried to spring an inspection on me with two days notice. The reason was “valuation”. When I questioned it, they sent me a link to QUEENSLAND tenant legislation. I looked up Victoria's, screenshotted it, and sent it back saying because they didn't give a week they couldn't come in to mine (yes, even though they were going to all the rooms that day. If the others let them in, that's their problem and I'm not sorry for the inconvenience. Do it properly or get out). The description of the place also said something about under-bed storage. No such storage exists. Property managers said we had to change our own lights, but at least my room has downlights, which I remember being told should be changed by a professional. They refused to do anything. The overhead range hood for the stove is supposed to have a light, but it doesn't work, creating a show when you're trying to cook. Absolutely zero storage in the bathroom but space for a cupboard (had to get my own because of course people keep things in their bathroom). Toilet seat never stays attached to the actual toilet. Stuff keeps falling apart and they have the audacity to increase the rent. It may be cheaper than getting into a normal rental on my own, but it's not worth what they're charging. I'm 1 out of about 10-14 units I think (I can't remember, j never took much notice). I'm still here, but they're gonna knock it down by the sounds of it some time next year. Only solid perk is it's across the road from my uni.

Nice land size. Owners live next door but they won't tell you. Broken roof tiles, ceiling in bedroom became mouldy, they just painted over the mould multiple times. The handyman was creepy towards female tenant. Kitchen was falling apart & they would just drill the doors back into the rotting ancient chipboard. Gutters were rusted out, heavy rain causes flooding in front carport area.

The landlord is the boss of your agent/ land manager. Had black mould and after 3 treatments they wanted us to empty the house so they can re paint for 2 months while still paying rent and no alternative accommodation. Had plants growing into a bedroom through the heating system and was always cold

Realestate told us they were going to demolish the house and rebuild so we were given 3 months notice to vacate, we vacated the property and moved. The property was VERY old and should have been demolished, however not long after they relisted the property for rent. The problems that the Realestate never repaired included: SEVERE mice infestation, broken water heater, mold and none of the windows locked.

Moved in and found out within 1 month we would be subject to continuous visits by all sorts of professionals to survey the property for a future development. These people started coming at random times without proper notice, despite our complaints. There was only 10 minutes of hot water many time throughout the day (likely due to a 20 year old tank that needed replacing) and the agent (Rachel Clemment) said that 10 mins of hot water is sufficient for a 3 bedroom house, which is hilarious and wildly incorrect. We had broken and not functioning blinds in the master, to which the provider decided was too costly to fix and would keep delaying the repair order by rejecting quotes for blinds for being too expensive. In the end we lived there for 3 months, fought with the real estate everyday to provide basic necessities, escalated to the managers at Ray White, served them multiple breaches of the tenancy act, threatened the hot water issue to go to VCAT and instead we were offered to leave early without any break lease fees. It was the worst 3 months of our 20 year renting history. Would tell anyone to stay away from this property (or a property managed by Rachel Clemment at Ray White).

We needed to dispose of personal items such as shoes and clothing as well as larger furniture items such as a leather couch and buffet style sideboard due to excessive mould. This is abety damp and cold house. It is poorly insulated, drafty and impossible to heat. There is a split system and gas heater in the same location in one room. We were left without a stove top for weeks. By the time we had moved out, the range hood had not been replaced, close to a year after it being found non compliant. Doors did not close properly on main and second bedroom.

Negatives:
- The house looks excellent in photos and even on inspection person; however, it was built specifically to flip (confirmed by neighbours). Once moved in, you begin to notice the little things. Like how although there are dozens of cupboards, they are all extremely shallow, severely limiting how much you can put in them. They're about 3 cans of baked beans deep. The closets are so shallow that you can't fit a standard clothes hanger in without turning it diagonal, and there's no closet shelving. The laundry shelves can fit 1 rolled up towel deep. 4 if stacked.
- The driveway is extremely narrow and steep and the car port is at the bottom, so it's basically un-usable as the side of the house is about 30cm from your car door.
- The walls have no insulation and are very "thin". I can hear the TV in the loungeroom at the back of the house from the office at the front of the house even when it's on a relatively normal volume.
- The water is very hard and has discoloured all of the bathroom tiling.
- Almost everything is gas, so expect your gas bills to sky rocket. During winter with 2 adults and 1 kid while setting the heating to only turn on for an hour or two at morning and evening, my quarter gas bill was over $1100.
- The house acts like a faraday cage so make sure you have internet because you won't be getting reception inside.
- No power point anywhere in the hallway or foyer so you've got no ability to have any lamps in that section of the house.
- Carpet in the bedrooms is low quality. Looks nice, but wears out real quick. 
- Back veranda timber is not treated.
- Laundry is tiny. I had to take one of the doors off to fit the front load washer/dryer combo. 
- Front door doesn't have a door handle, only a deadbolt which is extremely annoying. 

Positives:
- The current owner and real estate (based in Leura) are excellent. They have immediately fixed multiple things that were not cheap, and often have someone out for a quote within 2 days of a request. 
- The back garden is beautiful and has a small stream with a bridge and a large fish pond (though the lining is cracked and so the pond is leaking underground).
- Double glazed windows.
- Nice main bathroom. Decent master ensuite.
- Quality Smeg oven/gas cooktop and dish washer.
- Big butlers pantry. Nice large open-plan kitchen, dining, and lounge area.
- Heating works real well - but is costly.
- Massive under-house storage.
- Neighbours are nice.

It's the sun-penthouse is a super badly built Brady complex.  With moderate wind, the doors and windows in the master bedroom creak to the point that you can't sleep.  Not like a slight creak, imagine the kind of creak you imagine Captain Cook's boat would have in its hull when sailing through a storm! 
All the windows on the top floor leak. As do the skylights.  The damage was fixed when we vacated, but not the actual cause or issue.  One night we woke up to a thud and the ceiling over the stairs had collapsed in at 3am in the morning.  After we had spent 3 months reporting the issue to the agent.  
There's another big leak from the door behind the TV.  Which meant having to love with our TV in the middle of the lounge room for a month or so.  The kitchen cabinetry is also all peeling off.  It's a decent place on the surface.  But if you like to sleep and have a dry place, stay away!  Agent is 'nice' but also useless.  We lasted 9months out of a 12 month lease at a hugely reduced covid rent of $750 a week.  (It now rents at about $1100 a week.) The agent wanted us to stay but no chance.

House was filled with mould, constantly damp to the point of condensation dripping onto us while we slept, a lot of furniture and personal items developed mould including our mattress and the realestate refused to do anything about it, telling us to run the heater non stop and to keep windows open. The warm-n-dry system barely worked but because it was installed, they didn't think they had to do anything else. 
The stairs were also incredibly unsafe. There are around 60 outdoor stairs leading up to the house without any other access. They are steep, uneven, sloped and the handrail was always inaccessible at most points due to foliage overgrowth (which was meant to be tended to by a monthly gardener who never came). 
Any repair and maintenance requests were either denied or carried out often a lot of delay, and usually not done well or in one instance, the "contractor" showed up, did absolutely nothing and left after about 3 minutes. The realestate didn't seem to care and nothing came from it. 

At the end of the lease, the realestate tried to keep a large portion of the bond. I managed to reduce the amount, but they still kept a decent amount.

Shower leaks through the wall into the bedroom wardrobe. Meaning that the carpet is always soggy and promotes mould. Had to scrub mould off the bedroom roof very frequently. Need to run a dehumidifier overnight otherwise the walls and windows and moist and running. Terrible settlement cracks and disgusting paint
Leaking roof

If you love living in a mould infested house where the landlord just turns up when ever he feels.... this is the place for you. The house is so dark and cold with very poor lighting. House is starting to fall apart. Since living here the gas and water have also broke leading to huge bills. Power cuts out if you run multi things at once. Holes all over the place so aleays dirty. Mouse problem. We have been complaining about the issues for over a year with not even an inspection. We were constantly unwell living here. Best part of this house was leaving it. Just saw its up for lease and I'm scared for the next people who live here

Owner lives directly behind and looks over the low fence into the yard and can see into the master bedroom, kitchen, and living room if the curtains are open. Complained the real estate constantly about things she could see over the fence and the real estate regularly sent us emails and called us about her “complaints” so we felt like hostages the entire time we lived there

The place is falling apart. The owners left all sorts of rubbish including leaking bottles of hydrochloric acid in the back yard. We did manage to get some tradies in to fix a few things, and were told by several of them, unprompted, that the building was not up to legal standards to be rented.
Place is starting to fall apart, and any repairs that are done, are done by the owner, at the barest of bare minimum. (E.g. broken window? Bit of sticky tape fixes it!)

Deep mold not evident at onboarding due to them repainting the place between tenants and 2mths in it all turns to shit. Bedroom walls yellow to green & black mold. The hot water tank is stuffed and pumps green hot water. The agency & especially the female agent were/was an absolute nightmare, unprofessional and just ignorantly rude arrogant nasty POS. Upstairs  neighbors are thieves, rude and throw stuff incl cigarettes' onto balcony. Other neighbors are noisy and bbq drunks. Fire alarms and wash house issues and the constant ring of leaf blowers. The building leaks incl inside the flat and water seeps in from the balcony. Security is lacking and the doors are never locked. Cigarettes' stench from everywhere and screaming yelling neighbors in adjoining flats is constant. Mail boxes are constantly broken into. An absolute dump and agents needed strapping to a water wheel.

The place is in horrific condition. Windows don't open, and the ones that do are so rotted that they're no longer sealed. Mould in the bathrooms. Laundry is dusty and broken. Gardens are overgrown. 

Had to take the landlord to VCAT twice for basic repairs which included fixing the roof which leaked for 6 months and repairing the attic ladder which was unsafe and rendered the space unusable.

Electricity meter is inside the shop in front of the flat. The shop is never occupied so meter readers can never access it. This is illegal, the agent knows that and so does the landlord. She just doesn't want to pay for the meter to be moved out.
Our hot water heater malfunctioned which cost us thousands in electricity (every time we used hot water, even just for a second, it was re-heating the entire tank to almost boiling). We were dirt poor uni students at the time. Eventually they gave us 2 weeks free rent ($480) as 'compensation' for the 3k in electricity we'd paid for 10 months usage. 
Any repairs were done by a local 'handyman' who just made everything worse and then the landlord wouldn't get a proper tradie in for months because it was too expensive. No phone line so you had to use pre-paid usb dongles for internet. There was a hole in the bathroom wall that someone had placed some regular old A4 paper over and painted white. 
Property manager seemed to feel bad for us at times but wasn't able to stand up to the landlord much. 
This all happened a while ago now and I hope it's changed, but it seems unlikely going off the rental history and photos still being used.

Two of the bedrooms had black mould on the ceiling as well as the walls, which is a pretty glaring issue, and obviously a serious insult for a 4pm inspection that took me away from work. The house is pretty decent, but the photos on the listings are from when the property sold in 2011 and it looks VERY different now. Carpets hadn't even been vacuumed let alone cleaned.

The property history is grim: place was listed for 272 days in 2020 before someone moved in, then was leased in October 2022 for six months before being leased out again in April 2023, so it looks like there's a six month waiting game (probably you get evicted for asking for repairs). It does looks like the previous tenants had been hastily kicked out as there was a lot of furniture piled on the nature strip as well.

The real estate was a tiny bit of a run around, but we luckily dealt directly with the landlords (a couple) who were caring and understanding. They liked us as tenants (three university students at the time), came out personally to look at issues with the tradies (roof issues from age of the house) and were prompt to get things fixed when they became informed (house perimeter sprayed to keep the ants out of the bedrooms, taps, etc). We received little christmas gifts from them.

Lived there one year. 

Copper water pipe was stolen/missing to house when we moved in. Real Estate said it was there when they did the condition report - was clearly missing in the condition report. Owner offered us, our 2 dogs, 2 cats, to live in their back 1 bedroom bungalow while getting it fixed, but would need to share bungalow with family. Eventually had landlord's friend do a dodgy install with internal grade materials, not external. Was without water for 5 days.

Electrical inspection while we were there. Exposed wiring and dangling lightbulb socket in garage, electrician advised they cannot leave the property without shutting it off.

Plaster cracking in front hall (due to house foundation settling) - repairman advised would just come back, needed to be re-stumped. Landlord refused, showed up two days later unannounced "to inspect the repairs". Immediately get breach notice from RE due to the house being dirty - we were in the process of a big clean when the LL showed up, and we explained as much at the time. House was dirty when we moved in, so a lot of what we were cleaning was from that. LL complained about scratches in wooden floor - floors hadn't been re-finished in last 10 years, scratches were from having to move furniture multiple times for allowing heater technicians around.

Air Con stopped working. LL sent friend, who reset, and it worked for an hour and stopped. LL sent professionals, who advised that the install was dodgy (later found out it was LL friend) and water had pooled in the roof above the back door. Was falling in a solid sheet for 3-4 minutes. 

Heater didn't work entire tenancy. Multiple visits by landlord's friend - kept saying we were covering the vents, so it was shutting down (we weren't), and when professionals came out, they kept saying the whole system was shot. Eventually had professionals out but only had a job to repair the intake fan. Got advised they'd fix it after we moved out for the next tenant.
LL and friend showed up to fix again, landlord unannounced, and two days later got advised they wouldn't be renewing our tenancy (with 3 months left of lease).

Black mould and stains on lounge room ceiling, stained carpets with iron burns, white oven no-longer white (brown, covered in scratches), backyard wooden fence falling down, paint peeling on all walls and ceilings, generally uncared for and dirty. Listed as $480pw. When the agent was asked if the landlord was fixing the property, they said no and that the landlord does not want to do any work to it. The photos on the listing do not accurately show the condition of the property.
Agent is useless and abhorrent, property is structurally and hygenically unfit for habitation.

The owner of this place rarely repairs damage and usually done by himself (even asking for help from tenants). Property has had major leaks from storms and poor repair eventually forcing me to move. Blocked pipes, flooding backyard, nosey landlord it was only by threatening to take them to the tenancy union that he fixed the elecrical switches in the place. The entire block is owned by the same guy avoid if you care for your belongings or sanity.
Property had serious issues, mold, holes in floor boards, gas leaks illegal gas stoves

I lived there for 3.5years. I waited 2 years to have the back fence replaced. As soon as it was replaced I got a lovely rent raise. I waited over 12 months for a tree that had falled to be removed. 
I cleaned mould weekly.
Were useless when it came to maintenance.

Buxton accused me of stealing the taps from shower, laundry and bath and sink when I moved out. They were clearly in my exit photos dated 10 minutes before keys were returned.

House is fully asbestos in, and out. While not at all a health concern if in good condition and painted, it is cracked and deteriorating. The house did not come with a back door, we had to supply our own. And the hot water system was 15 years old and full of sediment and due for replacement, providing enough hot water for a 5 minute shower once per 24 hours. We had no water for our first 5 days of tenancy due to rusted iron pipes… No insulation, often over 40° internally during the QLD Summer. Where do I stop?

Landlord would never do repairs poor agent would try everything to get repairs done for us. Got heaps of quotes and the landlord would never allow the agent to get the work done. After the agents pleaded with her to do work she then came to my house with her son who was a tradie but did tell me it was her son they did basic repairs then when the landlord was leaving she said I hope you happy now and will stop whining. The agent fired her I would not rent this house or anything else owned by the the landlord. I live in a small town and she has other properties she rents and they are all the same.
Mould, possums, literally falling apart, no fence, landlord just shows up whenever he pleases, says you damaged something when it was really him.

There is no cooking stovetop, no oven, not aircon, not ceiling fan, no window flyscreen on either of the windows, no intercom, no parking on premises, share laundry that is coin operated and costs $6 minimum for a wash and dry, there's only 2 washers and dryers for about 40 units, the entire bottom floor shared hallway of the building is mouldy, the hot water in the apartment cuts out after 15 mins. This place is the absolute bare minimum.

REA was professional, responded to requests in a timely and efficient manner, and was always respectful. Property was clean upon move-in and any maintanence requests were dealt with promptly. The only issue we had was a pretty dodgy attempt to claim part of our bond due to a 'greasy rangehood' claim from the landlord at the final inspection. We hired professional lease cleaners at the end of our tenancy which included rangehood cleaning as part of the service. As soon as we asked for photos of the greasy rangehood to send to our cleaners, the REA suddenly found our condition report and saw that the rangehood was left in the same condition as at the beginning of the tenancy. Apart from that, they were always great to deal with but always be careful.

Really bad mould on the roof in the communal hallway, right outside my apartment door,  that was never fixed (asked the RE 5 times but never got a response) everytime it rained the mould spores would come under the door and the whole apartment would smell like mould. Both my cat and me began to have breathing problems almost immediately after moving in. The RE never did an inspection in the whole year that I lived there and never responded to any issues that I had. The RE also have a history of scamming tenants out of their bond and making a big deal about it. The landlord owns the whole building and he doesn't fix broken windows or anything, the whole building is a mess. My expensive sheets were stolen from the washing line downstairs by one of the neighbours who happens to be a kleptomaniac and steals other peoples washing all the time (I spoke to the other tenants). The only good thing about the place is the location, but even that wasn't enough for me to stay.

We lived with uncontrollable black mould & internal humidity for years (the walls were almost always wet, with drips going down the walls). They wouldn't fix the roof properly to address it. All my clothes, shoes, and furniture were destroyed. I had to clean my shoes before wearing them and spent a lot on carbon dehumidifiers for the closets. Our health declined. They came in to clean the mould once & bleached all of my stuff (rugs, blankets, furniture) in the process - thousands of dollars in damage, they offered $500 for inconvenience. The window frames were crumbling, contributing to humidity issues and cold drafts.

I overheard them at the open inspection blame the mould on us, having LITERALLY just told us we had taken such good care of the property and apologizing for the mould issue.
Can't tell you how many times we cleaned those damn ceilings.
They give the place a “fresh lick of paint” to cover the mold and smell before re-renting it out. Don't fall for it.

It also has a hot water tank, so no baths or more than 2 people showering. Their handyman didn't really fix anything, he even came in one day and ripped out our garden bed (which was compact dirt when we moved in) and left all the weeds….and called it weeding.

Needed repairs. Property manager ignored all written requests and said she was working on it when queried during inspections. Shower was cracked which was causesing excessive water damage to the outer walls in the laundry. The ovena wouldn't heat up. The hot plates worked on 2 settings. Off and hot. The place was broken into. Ray white attempted to charge me the damages on the front door and outer walls that were broken during the break in. I needed to cha ge my email due to losing access. Property manager decided to send inspection notices to old email and removed my new from the system.. when I lost my job I was breeched for the 2 weeks ahead that I used and threatened with a notice to vacate if I didnt get back ahead by 2 weeks..
 Ended up falking behind by nearly a month and managed to get a NTV overturned on the grounds I paid the overdue amount which I did. Funny thing my property manager left me a week behind and went forward with the notice to leave even though I had been in to make a full payment and paid what she had said was the full amount. Unfortunately for her she couldn't give me a NTV U Less I was behind and though I was a week behind according to her I was technically a week ahead...close to the end of my lease I was given the NTV and though I fought to stay I was rejected on the grounds I wasn't willing to pay an extra $120 a week on-top of my $340. So I organised to vacate asap. Managed to accomplish the move 5 days before my lease was up and handed my property manager the keys whilst have my outgoing inspection. I noted when she said I'd be losing my bond that each reason she had. Had already been reported for maintenance... a few weeks later after struggling to appli for my bond I start getting emails from property manager about said bill. Turns out they had taken me to VCAT. Not told me a thing. Takeny bond and had apparent had to remove me from the property. Funny as I had left 5 days before the end of my lease but apparently I was there to be removed from the property according to the real-estate agent. Currently in the process of suing the real-estate. Also looking to have to property manager crimi ally charged with fraud. A lot more to it. All documented and filmed. So the property manager literally has no hope of winning. No fake document she creates will save her .
Mould and water damage every where

No heating
Oven/stove don't work
Gravity hot water
Paper thin windows/walls
All cupboards rotting
Toilet leaks/not bolted to floor
60s fuse box, not to code and sparks
All fixtures old and breaking apart from those that I fixed at my own expense 
Very hot in Summer, freezing in Winter
Massive power bills
Inspections more than twice a year
Unresponsive Agent
Landlord regularly shows up without appointment and peers through the windows

If you look at it whilst not living there it seems pretty okay, other than the fact it is pretty dingy. 

However, there is a black mould problem in the bathroom, the fan in there doesn't work and there's no window so nothing you do can get rid of it, it just immediately comes back.

The kitchen stove is a fire hazard and needs to be replaced. It's a gas stove but when you turn on the burners the lighting of them is pretty explosive, much more than a normal stove. If there's anything within a foot of the stove it will catch on fire. There are burns on the countertop next to it too. And of course the extractor fan also doesn't work, so if you cook anything the fire alarm goes off.

The strip of backyard has these bushes that shed leaves constantly and because of the house set up there isn't anywhere to put them. So either your bin is constantly full of leaves that you have to clean up every week or you leave it and get to enjoy the smell of rotting leaves forever.

Numerous problems arose during our tenancy, after any heavy rain, water would run under our main door into the living room. Bathroom had no adequate ventilation and ceiling fan didn't expel air outside but rather blew it around in the bathroom. Agent failed to notify of us properly of the building undergoing major remedial works two weeks after we moved in and we had to live with scaffolding covering the building and our entrance, harmful dust created by the repointing works, tradies entering and exiting the property without our permission, mess left internally by tradies,  danger of falling tools from tradies all day. Rear balcony of the building was held up by acro-props. Any attempt to engage with the agent about issues were dismissed. I caught the landlord sneaking around the property while she thought we weren't home, landlord sent her son disguised as tradie to remove a giant tree branch fallen in backyard. The upstairs neighbours also do not have any floor covering on their wooden floors, and doesn't seem like there is anything but floorboards and a bit of plaster in between.

Absolute shit landlords. Carpets are falling apart and smelt of mould and were becoming a trip hazard, the father of the landlord claimed carpet was his “forte” and agent said carpet was in perfect condition. All the blinds don't work properly they fall off on your feet. 
There's a hole out in the yard that constantly floods the backyard it's the neighbours gray water. The landlords don't care. The place has absolutely gone past it's expiration and needs clear renovations. when you exit the property the landlord will try and claim all your bond. And if he doesn't agree with the agent he finds a new agent. 
The back fences were falling over but I was told they were in good condition. 
Wanted to increase the rent by $50 after sending Mutiple property's in the area comparing , saying the house isn't worth the increase, he threatened to evict me if I didn't agree. 
The real estate agent are lying manipulating people and have no care or respect for anyone.

Black mould throughout the house, floor caved in in one of the bedrooms, took the LL six months and multiple threats of VCAT to fix it. No fan or ventilation in bathroom. Tried to take our bond money for marks on ancient, mouldy carpet. I have never been more sick in my life while I was living in that house. Holes in walls and floors gave us a vermin issue. Real estate were terrible and the landlord does not care as long as he gets his pay check.

Black mould everywhere, second bedroom wall covered in it. Unsafe to even walk through (threw my clothes in the wash straight after!) but it appears children are currently living there! Outrageous and the agency should be so ashamed!
Smells damp immediately, I'd assume there's mould in the carpets and then tell tale painted over dark patch of mould was visible in the bathroom.

Insufficient waste disposal, 1 household sized bin of each type for 5 apartments, no insulation, windows didn't properly close and had no flyscreens. Despite asking for the waste disposal issue to be fixed almost fortnightly (as the bin would overflow within 12 hours of the bin being collected) it was not fixed in the time I lived there. Since moving out a few years ago, there are now 2 bins of each type on the property, which I can guarantee is still not sufficient for 5 apartments.

Rent was cheap, but still definitely too much for the size and quality of the place.

This isn't the landlord/agency's fault but one of the neighbours would also sing really really loudly and out of tune all hours of the day, which was really really annoying.

This apartment is really old and it seems that little has been done to renovate and update it since it was built. The landlord is a tight ass and dragged their feet to repair the leaking kitchen sink. The oven is old and faulty, it was "repaired" a couple of times but these fixes never lasted long. The bathroom is mouldy since there is no ventilation and the landlord refuses to install an exhaust fan. There is barely any natural light in the living room area and kitchen since the light is blocked out by the neighbouring apartment. The whole place was poorly painted and the paint in the bathroom, kitchen and living room started peeling and cracking within 6 months of moving in. The real estate agents were fine to deal with for the most part, but the landlord expects to make a good financial return through expensive rent without putting any investment into maintaining the property.

Property Managers were sociopaths. 

House had several structural integrity issues. 

Had several cracks appear in the ceiling of the master bedroom, was not deemed a concern by the property managers. Ceiling ended up collapsing. Plasterers left a small paint stain on the carpet, which we reported to the property managers. Property managers then claimed they knew nothing about it during bond claims. 

Property manager claimed our entire bond without any receipts or reason. “Found” a single cockroach after the property was empty for several days and claimed it was “infested” with pests. 

Property managers charged us for removal of rubbish that was there when we moved in. 

Shower stopped working twice. Had to take it to QCAT to get anything done. 

Property manager forged my signature on the entry report. 

Reported to RTA who stated that they couldn't do anything about our bond because the property managers wouldn't pick up the phone.

First night we moved in a light fitting that was hanging from a cable on the roof fell down and sparked on the oven, taking all the electricity out. They had to rewire the whole house as the electricity board wasnt to standard and was really old. A month into the tenancy we found a massive mould patch in our bedroom behind the wardrobe they had supplied. They sent someone to fix the mould, contractors told us they had been there a few months beforehand and showed us all the panelling they had installed in the loungeroom to cover up the mould already. We had property destroyed by mould after the contractors came to fix it, they knowingly rented to a couple with a young baby. We negotatied to break the lease and they didnt penalise us for it which was fine - but really negligent to rent a house you know has mould to people with a young baby. The loungeroom was also painted concrete which was the slab to the house - walls werent sealed and bugs would come in through the cracks. We were all really sick living in this house and for months after.

The property is very large and in a new building, however extremely poorly built.

Water began to pool in the ceiling above our lounge as a result of insufficient drainage on the upstairs neighbours balcony. 

The entire apartment has a distinct toxic smell that we became used to while living there but caused light headedness and health issues that were attested to by doctors. The property manager put the onus on us to conduct expensive air testing and refused our request to terminate the tenancy early as a result of health issues. 

The apartment building itself flooded several times dues to bad drainage leaving the entire first floor in ankle deep water - including on the day we vacated the property resulting in many of our belongings becoming water logged. 

The garage has a car stacker that broke down often leaving residents unable to access their cars. 

While living there we received body corporate complaints and accusations of misconduct regularly, including for drying our laundry in the sun on our balcony (there is no shared clothes lines - we were told we should by a dryer) and having a small 'climate action' sign on the balcony. 

The property has a large balcony, however it faces Dandenong road meaning it is very loud and constantly covered in soot from exhaust fumes. 

Despite appearing like a very luxurious apartment on inspection, we did not enjoy living here.

DO NOT LIVE IN THIS BLOCK OF 4 FLATS. TW: Suicide. 

The landlord would regularly knock on doors and enter the property unannounced which is illegal. He harassed tenants, touched people's belongings and went in their laundries. When a young person committed suicide in one of the apartments, he harassed her family and asked them to pay for the damage caused by the police when they broke in to try and save her. His despicable behaviour left us all traumatised. The plumbing is also very faulty and we were expected to pay the bills for its frequent repairs. LJ Hooker Ashfield handled the situation without empathy and are too spineless to stand up to him. These sorts of people should not be allowed to be landlords. The address is 184 Wardell Rd, Marrickville but listed as Dulwich Hill.
Termite damage through floors and walls and mould in shower, kitchen , laundry and one of the bedrooms

This property already has a review, and I agree with all of the points it made about the landlord/agent. I lived there earlier, and what this review had missing is that the landlord, for many years, operated an illegal squalid boarding house behind the property, with individual  outdoor rooms, as well as a kitchen and bathroom, with no common indoor areas (i.e to get from one room to another you had to go outside). This boarding house housed some pretty vulnerable people evidently (People with drug addictions, or in poverty), and while there is nothing wrong with low a cost accommodation for these people, I'd say it's a necessity - the living conditions were absolutely squalid. The rooms had broken windows, doors, damaged plumbing, and garbage everywhere. I'm not exaggerating when I say I've seen slums overseas that were in a better state.
It was so uninhabitable that eventually local authorities got involved, the property was deemed unlivable, as it was deemed a fire and health risk. Fixing up these rooms was determined to be IMPOSSIBLE - it was that bad. The tenants living in this boarding house were told they had to leave, some of them forced in to homelessness. 
When this happened, the residents in the front property (the terrace house) were given a huge rental increase (like it's their fault the landlord operated a slum). Meanwhile, the boarding house at the rear of the property, then vacant was left as is - garbage, syringes,  and furniture strewn throughout the backyard for about 6 months. Landlord does not care about leasing out property that is livable by any standard - he simply does not care. He was running illegal accommodation for years and only stopped because he got caught. I would strongly advise against ever moving in to this house.

Rental was in tatters when I moved in, no oven, no real kitchen the place was very messy and the hot water cylinder was broken, even after explaining to nest property that I left home at 6:45am and got home past 7:00pm that I couldn't have possible used $2,500 of power per month for a total bill of $6,500 they offered me $400 to pay the difference on the bill leaving me with $6,100 out of pocket which at the time was most of the down payment I had on a house of my own they refused to help and the landlord blatantly ignored my request to have this fixed on numerous occasions

Mouldiest house I've ever lived in. Clearly landlord specialed where they just painted over the mould. It made me so sick that I developed eczema and allergies that I still can't get rid of after living nearly three years there. 130 year old house that obviously hadn't had any renovation since the 90s when it was bought as a cheap investment property. Railing on very steep stairs was unsafe and nearly seriously injured me several times. Holes in the floor that went straight to the dirt and literally let rats inside. Despite this, tried to raise the rent every time the lease came up. Short stay accommodation surrounded the house and we had no real neighbours, just people coming and going at all times who filled up our bins and constantly parked in our designated car spot. Only reason it's not a 1 is because the landlord was relatively chill and let us do whatever we wanted (probably coz they didn't give a fuck) and at the time it was somewhat cheap.

It was obviously an old property which wasn't the problem, it turned out to have a massive pest problem, mice found dead inside the pool and running inside the house. Cockroaches regularly inside bedrooms, and spiders everywhere inside and out. This was only months after moving in, when I contacted the agency about it we were told it was because we were leaving food out even though we weren't. And then told to just fix it ourselves. The house also was not clean at all when we moved in, having lived at a few rental properties we already know the standard that is requested when people vacate, it was far from that standard and then when we left the property they tried to charge us for things that weren't upheld when we moved in. For the amount of rent they charge, definitely time for some renovations.
