Large house that had been a rooming house. None of the windows closed properly therefore dust, noise and heat couldn't be kept out. They did replace the carpets recently and they're good. Second bathroom is a later addition with a false wall overing a large window, very poor air circulation and regularly had mystery fungus growing from the cracks in the shower tiles. No proper insulation, depending on the seasons the house was either baking or freezing cold. This caused issues with damp in the winter. The property is owned as an investment by the group that owns Chadstone Shopping Centre, meaning all requests for repairs take a significant amount of time to be reviewed and acted on.

0 insulation or heating/cooling. In winter you could literally see your breath and in summer we would avoid coming home from work until the sun went down. The house was infested with rats when we first moved in and has black mould issues during rainy periods. 0 maintenance in the bathroom and kitchen. No storage or built ins. We moved in at $585 per week, left because they wanted to raise the rent to $800 per week.

The house is beautiful it's got nothing to do with the house. I'm not sure if the owners lived next door or somewhere else on the street but we'd get regular texts from the agency telling us the owner drove past and saw the lawn wasn't tidy, the owner drove past and saw someone parking on the lawn, the owner drove past and said the tree needed to be cut down. Little comments like that without having had inspections or anything, makes you feel uneasy and like you're constantly being watched. Don't rent your house out if you don't want people to live in your house. They also could not renew our tenancy because they said family would be moving into the house, just to find out it was back up being posted to rent out and at a higher rent.

Lovely home, the landlord is a sweet old man that lives nearby and he attends to any issues in a really prompt manner. He always came to look at any problems and got tradesmen in as soon as he could. He was very kind, even loaned us his lawnmower when ours broke and gifted us home grown seedlings. The house is older but kept in fair condition, ducted gas heating worked a treat and we had no real complaints. Would happily live there again

Unit itself wasn't bad when we first moved in. While it was managed by an agency, the landlord insited on doing all repairs himself. The carpet and whole place was filthy, I spent two days cleaning before we moved in. I hired a carpet shampoo machine from bunnings and cleaned the carpets myself. Huge cracks in the tiles in the shower made it impossible to clean, the more you tried to clean it the more chunks of mould would spill out. The carpet was also really worn thin, in some areas the securing wood and nails were exposed and a hazard, took the landlord a few weeks to remedy this. The toilet broke and was unable to half flush, the landlord again took a number of weeks to fix it. He refused to use a proper tradesman and did it himself. The toilet bowl was not secured to the flooring after his repairs and would rock when you sat on it. The gas ducted heating broke and it took him upwards of 10 weeks before deciding whether to repair or replace. During this time he asked if we would be open to a $20 per week rent increase. He ended up replacing the ducted central heating with a single split system in the living room. Meaning the windowless bathroom started growing mould. The property manager was great and she was really on our side, it was the landlord that made life difficult.

Furnished student accommodation (that's not even limited to students). The carpet, furniture, mattress and blinds were all still 90's originals. Which didn't get cleaned between tenants. Lots of chips, cracks, peeling and even rust in the unit and around the complex. Front screen door never locked from the inside - landlord advised to put something heavy behind the door at night instead. There was never enough hot water and everyone I knew in a ground floor unit had ongoing problems with ants. The "fully equipped” kitchen left a lot to be desired and lack very basic items - including no baking pans, tongs, chopping board or dinner bowls. Seemed more like “random stuff of no value previous tenants left behind”. 

Landlord/office staff was unfriendly, rude and lacked compassion. They retaliated with nasty, passive aggressive comments whenever you filed a complaint with the RTA. Including once hiding a package of mine for a month after I complained of an entry without notice. They rolled their eyes and acted like I was being difficult when I requested forms have the correct spelling of my name on them. Once when I was hospitalised and late with my rent, they just said "hospitals have wifi". Called me a social recluse because I choose not to got to their little pizza “parties” (which they made you pay for) and because (I kid you not) I liked to pay my rent through online banking instead of going to their office every week.

1. Carpet in the toilet... why?
2. Serious black mould problem, evidence that mould has been painted over 
3. Springtails living in the floor
4. Advertised with air-conditioner included - this doesn't work and is not included
5. Refused to let us break lease early despite having a medical certificate that stated we were having health issues as a result of mould.

There was mold, cracks in the walls, the doors were off the ground so massive spiders and even a snake once got inside. The shower door constantly broke, the landlord refused to do any yard work despite there being a communal garden. We could hardly get to our door and used to have to cut branches with kitchen siscors. 
They raised our rent in the middle of our lease. There were nicer, more modern properties for less rent going on the same street.
One inspection they came with more than just the landlord (there were at least 5 more people) which they hadn't notified us of beforehand.

This property has serious plumbing and black mould issues. Attempts to seek help from Ray White West End fell on deaf ears, they just ignored me and when they did respond they were so rude. A horrible real estate, they are only nice until you sign the lease. 
The property itself wasn't cleaned before I moved in as well, it was disgusting. Later, a maintenance worked for the agency told me that they don't actually do exit conditions reports, they just wait for new tenants to move in and report the issues. I left after just 3 weeks, breaking a 12 month lease. There was no dispute from the agent and my bond was returned immediately, they knew they were completely in the wrong but also took advantage of the situation.... They immediately advertised the awful property for $50 more a week and some poor, oblivious person would have rented it.

review: Dodgy takes money (pet bond), 1 weeks to get hot water system fixed. Moved in with exposed wires on water system, grass to knees.  EXCEPTIONALLY RUDE.  She accused me of changing the locks on the place.   Ripping permanent tenants off.  SO SO RUDE

I moved in here a “partially furnished property” to find the furniture in the house was placed in front of walls that had mould all over them, i scrubbed every surface possible with vinegar and for months my stuff kept getting destroyed by mould, property manager did nothing to rectify any mould problems other then having the mould on the roof in the bathroom painted over, no ventilation AT ALL in the bathroom so the place was always moist

Took ages for them to fix stuff that was stuffed. The rent increases were quick and the agent forwarded us an email after the place was clean and empty for us to "scrubb the showers better and fix the carpets"  we left the place cleaner than when we moved in.
It is falling apart why they fixed some minor things there are huge structural issues and using outdated photos for advertising

The landlord split one building into a separate building/residence while declaring them as one. We didn't have a functioning phone line unless the phone companies cut off the business below us, and it took about a year to have internet wired to my residence. The downstairs portion of the house was unliveable and had no privacy, and was stumped so long ago that running was downright hazardous and walking would give guests vertigo. The oven never worked. Nor did the bathtub. The landlord had screwed all the windows shut and complained when I unscrewed them. There was extensive water damage to the house and parts of the ceiling had given way (the fix was done with varieties of sticky tape). The landlord kept his vintage car in the garage and when local businesses would park in front of it he would knock on our door at any hour to ask me to have the cars moved. I caught him multiple times standing outside looking into the  property windows. He'd done all the electricity himself and according to a private tradie, he'd crossed it with the plumbing, which proved to be a hazard when the water heater blew up and I was electrocuted turning on a light switch. The real estate were negligent entered the house multiple times without permission or when they thought my roommates and I weren't home. There was a big drama with the water bill as Melbourne Water had never been notified that the property was being rented out, and it was registered in the landlord's wife's name under a private business. We were paying the water bill (hefty due to constantly leaking taps and meter), but the invoices weren't ever addressed to us until we eventually threatened VCAT. There's a single split system unit in the uninhabitable downstairs living room, and the place would get so unbearably hot in the summer that we would have to stay with friends.

Structurally there wasn't too many issues with this property. It was just a sad place to live. For example, there was broken up brick pebbles all over the backyard without a hint of grass. Not a great deal of sunlight either. The major cause for concern was actually the landlord who lives two houses down. He tried to fight my housemates boyfriend a few weeks after moving in because he had parked on the street and threatened to have us kicked out, the property manager at the time gave us the option to relocate if we felt unsafe but we figured it would stop after we complained about it so we declined. He would show up un announced if we requested repairs and assert that he could repair things himself and/or recruit our 80 something year old neighbour to fix it. He was aggressive towards us and our neighbours on several occasions (including the 80 something year old). Overall he made us feel extremely uncomfortable as 3 female young adults so I would be weary of that if you fall into that demographic. At the end of our tenancy, our property manager was negligent with our exit report and the landlord refused to negotiate a reasonable bond refund. We ended up at tribunal and won most of the claims. Overall not a great experience, but the house isnt the worst you've ever seen.

When we moved in, we noted a few issues we had with the condition of the property which were never addressed or took months and months of fighting. The toilet pipe was leaking and the bowl constantly trying to fill, so we turned the tap off to stop it only to find it also leaked at this tap. Landlord and agent did not send anyone out for months and insisted we pay the huge water bill it racked up due to the neglect. Offered to pay half as that was our normal usage but they refused. Then a heavy rain spell that sydney got around early 2022 came. We had black mould in all rooms, especially bad in the bedroom which I ended up having to clean by myself every week for it to come back. Eventually the strata came to inspect as I assume more townhouses were having issues, and they found that there was no drainage holes in the walls of the upstairs balcony causing water to be held in all walls of the house. Property was fully covered by trees too so no light to help dry any of the moisture. Our bedroom floorboard buckled up and eventually got ripped up as it was unsafe, water was leaking through the walls and making the paint bubble and all our furniture and clothes got ruined from the mould as well as our health with no compensation or accountability.

Landlord took 2 months to fix a broken oven, drug related crimes committed by prior tennants and not disclosed as per legislation,  tried to pin damage from the Police raid of the last tennants on us, cracked roof tiles unfixed, mould as a result, birds nesting in gutters and roof cavity

Don't let the affordable rent fool you, the walls are paper thin so you can hear neighbours banging, walking, music etc. 
if that's not bad enough, the neighbouring townhouses have children running around in the road, leaving toys out and let their cat out loose which scratched up our car. Don't even bother talking to the neighbour because they do not care about the damages!
Neighbouring children would also climb the fence to look into backyard and house, as well as stare through the front window while screaming constantly. Couldn't have your curtains open, never mind opening a window.
Cars constantly parked along the narrow road illegally, as well as across your driveway. 
The townhouses are literally under investigation because the builders did such a poor job, I can't even remember how many times we had tradies coming through to FIX THE ROOF BEAMS so that it wouldn't collapse on our heads. 
If all this doesn't convince you, they also feel that the shit house should have a rent increase! 
Wouldn't send my worst enemy to live here, it's not worth the cheaper rent.

Completely infested with everything it could possibly be infested by, rot and mold, parts of the house are falling apart, rotted, flaking away, the concrete in the back is weathered and the fence is unsafe to lean on.

Property badly maintained. Landlord drops in unannounced. Property manager unprofessional and fights with tenants. Has unreasonable standards of cleanliness and judged by home furnishings (eg. complained about clutter in a storage shed, complained about tenants owning a neat stack of plastic chairs). Harassed the tenants multiple times a day to remove 'clutter' in storage shed, and for photographs that the clutter has been removed. No maitenance completed over the entire tenancy. Tried to keep our bond for spiders (And sent a 6 page document to VCAT, photographing all the spiders.) Property manager attempted to lie to VCAT to try and make the tenants look bad. Landlord refused to limit in person inspections or visitors during the pandemic and there was over 12 visitors between March 2020- August 2020. In a rental crisis they are still unable to keep tenants for longer then 12 months, so I think these issues must be ongoing. Do not rent.

Have lived in the house for 3 years and in the 3 years the landlord has shown up unannounced without notice and has threatened to throw us out / end our lease because we asked for repairs to the front fence/gate. The front gate does not open (even after "repairs")(we had to climb over for a number of months before threatening to go to QCAT). The shower had holes in the bottom/sealing and water would leak out and the shower was moldy continuously. The back stairs look like a toddler made them with lego, they are all different heights and are slowly rotting away. The front stairs were actually rotted away when we first moved in but had a fresh coat of paint - we had to wait almost 16 months to have them repaired. There is no drain in the only bathroom so water cant drain away and the bottom of all the walls are moldy. we haven't had lights outside the property throughout the entire tenancy and the light fixtures have live wires hanging down sealed with masking tape - the agency know; we told them - they just don't care.

This property is not fit for renting or even owning! It has been let out numerous times with unresolved water leaks and the strata kept on hiring trades who would "patch" the leaks and "repair" some plumbing to. I cannot tell you how many times I had to ring the out of hours service to have my water shut off and temporary fixes made throughout the night. The MOULD, omg the mould!! It got so bad that tenants had to sleep in their loungerooms to avoid it - for more than 4 months! The freakin landlords didn't give a shit - apparently it was all stratas fault, yet they had the AUDACITY to want to increase our rent!! These issues were also promised to be amended prior to first moving in but were very slowly tended to and never completely fixed. It got so bad we were even recommended to take out an *expensive* house insurance policy due to the predictable nature of this property. It needs to be torn down and the landlords should be ashamed of themselves! Do NOT rent this property!!!

If you love loving in a house where you wake up sick every single day then this place is for you. We ran a machine to remove water from the air and filled it within hours. The room would continuously grow mold all over our furniture which was apparently our fault because we couldn't get direct sunlight into the room (due to the way house is positioned) and because we couldn't have our window opened every minute of the day.

 The bathroom drain would have a disgusting smell coming out of it especially through summer (smelt like sewerage) but nothing would be done.

What is drainage you ask? the answer is who knows because the backyard has absolutely none so it floods. cms from entering the back door and will enter via the garage door then it will take days upon days to weeks to dry out so if you were hoping to get use out of this yard then sorry, it's not going to happen unless you feel like a stomp in the mud which they will then complain about and expect you to fix the grass when the damage was caused by rain and lack of drainage.

Everything kept breaking. When we asked for a stove top to be replaced because it was actually giving off electric shocks the landlord ignored it and instead after a few months later the landlord and agent told us we had to move out by a certain date. We initially took photos of the dangerous stove top and emailed to the agent, once again no response. Young children were also lived at the residence. After spending 2 whole days cleaning, scrubbing getting professional carpet cleaning done. The house looked better than the day I moved in. We had ongoing maintenance costs that we paid for. The water pump was constantly having problems. The bathroom was leaking into the kids bedroom. The landlord dropped off a few things and told me to fix the bathroom. The landlord would regularly just turn up to help herself access the other building. So the day we handed over the keys the landlord was there with her new man. We had never met him but instantly he tried flexing his muscles complaining about the pickiest things. So regarding the stove, this boyfriend of the landlord thought we had left but I had to go back to grab my sunglasses and I witnessed him in the kitchen with his entire body weight pushing on the stove glass until it cracked in half. The landlord took photos of all the picky little things and included them in the report. Of course the damages to the stove was blamed on us. The landlord even took a photo of a spider web that was outside near the clothes line and said we didn't even clean the webs down. One tiny web is absolutely ridiculous. We were the tenants that owners dream of and the agent teamed up with the landlord to get an easy money grab. I documented all expenses that we paid for over our time living there and it was well over $4000.00. We constantly emailed the agent requesting they fix the dangerous or essential problems. They never would instead they would just put a Band-Aid on the problem. So here's the Clanger…..
The landlord refused to give any of the bond back and on top of that forcefully demanded we pay an extra to replace the stove and other unfairly and fraudulent documents. It was just horrible knowing that my wife and I met all the requirements and more while being tenants at this property. We were completely taken advantage of and totally ripped off by a dodgy agent and a dishonest greedy and horrible landlord.

Not a great deal of sunlight either. The major cause for concern was actually the landlord who lives two houses down. He tried to fight my housemates boyfriend a few weeks after moving in because he had parked on the street and threatened to have us kicked out, the property manager at the time gave us the option to relocate if we felt unsafe but we figured it would stop after we complained about it so we declined. He would show up un announced if we requested repairs and assert that he could repair things himself and/or recruit our 80 something year old neighbour to fix it. This house really is the gift that keeps on giving. From the wonky unlevel kitchen to the luxury outdoor bath and caravan step to get into the house it really has it all. The beauty is really met at the front gate when you go to enter the property when it's bared off.

When I moved here I was told there was dust on the windows I wasn't told that the previous tenants smoked inside and the unit smelt like an actual ash tray all through out the house. The land lord would rock up un announce all the time just to talk to me even though I asked him to leave me alone. He even came into my house just to break my garage door. Even when I told the real estate time and time again he would still rock up and then raised the rent from $320 to $400 pw for a two bedroom unit
The house is riddled with mould

Two years in this property. When we were told we were the successful applicants, we were also told that the real estate had 'accidentally' not advertised the actual rental price stipulated by the landlord, so it was increased by about $20. We opted to still take the property rather than keep looking. When picking up the keys, we were given a long list of repairs due to be completed which were promised to be completed and noted on the lease as forming part of the condition of the property. The most impactful of these ended up being holes in fly screens and broken power points (which had allegedly been punched by the previous tenant, and you kind of had to stick your finger inside the socket to turn them on….eek!). The fly screens were never repaired, instead the agency instructed us to put sticky tape over the many holes. We did, but never worked as well as actually functioning fly screens = constant supply of flies and other assorted bugs (repaired fly screens were part of the rental agreement). We had to send some cranky emails to finally get the power points repaired, pointing out the risk of death by electrocution as being a relatively likely scenario before they did anything.

When we first got the keys and opened the house, the lounge room absolutely reeked of cat urine. The agent assured us it had been professionally cleaned as the previous owners had allegedly had cats in the house. The agency thankfully sent carpet cleaners again, who used a blue light to show where the urine damage was, and it took up about 1/4 of the carpet. The carpet was very worn and it was suggested the it should be replaced, as cleaning it wouldn't help. Well, carpet was cleaned again, and continued to smell. Especially on a nice of summers day, which was exacerbated by having no insulation in the ceiling of our western facing wall. 

Walls had lots of patching from holes being punched in them, and a quick paint job to cover up. There was one room that had quite old yellow sticky stuff on it that we forgot to put in our entry condition report (our error). 

When we left, we were advised we weren't getting some of our bond back due to the sticky stuff on the wall, and some damage to skirting. Luckily, we had photos of the damaged skirting. We requested quotes for the approximately $500 bill for patching the paint. We disputed it, and lodged a tribunal application. After we lodged it, the real estate told us they were dropping the claim for the repairs due to “how unreasonable you are being.” Our tribunal appeal was also seeking compensation for loss of enjoyment due to things that weren't repaired (the list was longer than mentioned above) and having to deal with cat piss scented carpet every time it got really hot outside (and even hotter inside the uni uninsulated house). I'll always giggle at the 'unreasonable' comment, but it was a really unnecessarily stressful time, having a real estate fight us so hard for an owner that was happy for his tenants to live under these conditions.

The landlord that owns this property has absolutely ZERO boundaries regarding his tenants and for anything that he can't "fix" himself, he will have a distant relative or family friend that can do the job cheaper than an actually qualified tradesperson.... with the quality and execution of a kindergartener at craft time. 
In the 5 years that I lived at the property he continually dropped by unannounced, did regular "drive pasts", asked for spare cigarettes and then would smoke them inside whilst "fixing" things (we never smoked inside), and, would find any and all means to blame others (either tenants, racial slurs in manufacturing of parts etc) when maintenance of the property was requested. 
The house itself had significant water damage from bubbling paint and white mould from the walls, leaking walls when it rained, windows that could not be sealed when shut unless you had one person outside pushing and the other inside to pull the lever, and, plumbing so old, rusted and root invaded that this houses most used accessory was a drain plunger.
Bathroom smelt foul, mould everywhere, wouldn't action it when requested, constant blockages in pipes, took ages to action it, property managers x2 were trash.

I rented 15/6 Francis Grove Thornbury VIC from February 2021 to February 2022. The flat was covered in dust when I moved in, mould all over the bathroom ceiling and tiles, mould growing on the bedroom window shades. I had to take the landlord to court to get the mould removed, four out of the five windows were broken when I moved in (and after a year only two of the windows were fixed), the floors were old carpet or lino, some of the lights were bare lightbulbs hanging from the ceiling, the bedroom wall had a hole in it where you could see through to the outside and when I raised it with the maintenance guy he said and I quote, "You want the airflow though, these places get a lot of damp". The lock on my flat's letterbox had been broken open before I moved in, and was never repaired despite my requests, so my mail was open to being stolen by the known mail thief we had in the area. The rent for this shabby ground-floor 1-bedroom flat was $1195/month, which at the time was about 68% of my Disability Support Pension. The flat is surrounded closely by other flats and has an upstairs flat, so you get surround-sound ambience of your neighbours's plumbing, sex noises, vomiting, arguing, TV, talking on the phone, everything. While I lived there, most of the neighbours had a group text about the neighbours from hell who terrorised the rest of us. The hell neighbours would sexually harass me when I left my flat, hang out in the garden right outside my windows and leave their empty beer tins on my window sill, look in my windows, steal my deliveries (they stole everyone's deliveries), throw pot plants and knives off their balcony in fits of rage, and unplug my hot water system. The final straw for me was when I found one of the neighbours committing arson outside my bedroom window one night. I found out from the group text it wasn't the first time he'd done arson at the apartment complex. I moved out after that (my mental health was in pieces). The body corporate knew because several tenants were keeping them informed, Haughton Stotts knew because I informed them, the Northcote police station knew, everyone knew about all the problems happening at 6 Francis Grove, but no one with any power to help did anything about it. Most of the people living there were living quiet modest lives, a lot of us on low incomes, and our quality of life meant nothing to the people in power. Quiet enjoyment was not a thing. I only gave this rental a 2 instead of a 1 because it had air-conditioning in the living room and a bathtub (although ancient and rusty) and was ground floor so I could access the flat with my disability, which is a fucking unicorn of a combo in inner north Melbourne rentals. There was a nice community there and it was connected to a heritage-listed old mansion set back off a quiet street away from traffic noise, and could have been a lovely sanctuary of for people on low incomes in the inner north, but landlords just wanted to collect ridiculous amounts of rent on shitty old flats they bought for a song in the 1970s and knew they could just replace me with another unsuspecting tenant after the horrendous living situation had burned me out. No one warned me before moving in there of all the antisocial problems happening at that property, which were well-known and probably still happening. The flat I lived in, number 15, was apparently one of the worst locations for it because I was kind of in the centre of everything and the yelling/arson/violence/drinking etc would happen literally a foot from any of my windows. It often felt unsafe to go out my front door, and the group text confirmed that being a young woman meant I was copping it worse than other tenants had. So I'd like to warn anyone thinking about renting 15/6 Francis Grove Thornbury, especially if like me they were driven there by the lack of disability-accessible or affordable rentals in inner north Melb. They should at least know what they're getting into.
A horrible property manager

Carpet was filthy. Landlords would show up unannounced for "matinence" multiple times they were found rummaging in our trash bins. They'd use weed poisoning spray without notice to put our dog in a safe area. The bath tub didn't drain just pooled under the foundation and caused it to rot and start sinking. Roof was full of mice feaces and leaked down the walls during heavy rain. Also an awkward sublet granny flat which had a "yard" fenced off that takes a chunk out of the main back yard. Roof over the "shed" was being held down by large rocks and logs.

Got mould poisoning living here. Its also listed as a 2 bedroom but its not. The “second room” is a sunroom that cannot fit even a single bed. Mould throughout the entire apartment is painted over and is under the floorboards/walls. Paper thin walls. Closets and shelving is all cheap falling apart DIY. Had surfboards, clothes, and a bike stolen at this property from the shared common yard. Agency is useless for help and then at the end will try everything to not return your bond.

The rental was a two story house dived into two flats and I had the bottom floor. The person living upstairs decided he no longer wanted to live there and subletted to a friend who was a junkie. In the time he lived there he set fire to the kitchen, would have sketchy people coming to the property late at night and would verbally abuse me and bang on my windows as I reported him to the real estate. The real estate did nothing to make him leave and in doing so endangered my safety in the process. The landlord was another issue. When the upstairs subletter left the landlord would show up unannounced to “inspect the property condition” but this would be at least twice a week. The landlord later started coming over almost everyday and would either do some gardening or just sit in the back yard. One time I came home from work and he even parked his boat in my driveway preventing me from parking my car on the property which I was entitled too. I spoke with the property manager who told me she actually found him quite creepy and said she would speak to him on the matter. She did email him saying that he cannot show up unannounced and without a reason and that he needs to respect my privacy as no where on my rental agreement was it mentioned that he would be at the property. Some days if he was gardening he would knock on my door and ask to come sit inside or ask for a cold drink which I honestly could not believe.

Landlord won't fix anything, but still put the rent up. 
No air con for 6 months in summer, no heating for 5 months in winter.
Cupboard door fell off and no repairs for 18 months.
Dishwasher broke and no repairs for over 4 months (and still waiting).
Windows leak, creating dampness and mould, no repairs for entire 18 months we've been living here.
Real estate agent has been amazing, but can't initiate any repairs without landlords approval and landlord won't answer any of her emails.
He's the builder of the house and clearly a shit builder. Place leaks like a sieve and nothing works. And yet the rent goes up!

When we moved into the property it hadn't been cleaned and was disgusting. There was toothpaste in both showers a cockroach infestation and the worst of it was the oven, it was so disgusting and had a lot of build up. We called the real estate to request they send out a cleaner as it was not fair for us to do it and on fair trading it states a property must be cleaned before handover. The real estate said that cleaners were very booked out and it wouldn't be for a number of weeks and we said we were happy to wait but this never happened. The oven didn't work as the electrician said that he doubted it had ever been cleaned and the whole thing needed to be replaced. The bedroom doors bottom half was broken off which never got fixed and we had to beg to have the garage door fixed as it would go back up after closing and the door on the inside didn't have lock so our house was in risk of being broken into. Every time we spoke to the property manager she was so rude to us and spoke to us as if we were children

My partner and I have been living here for 3.5 years. Almost 2 years ago the roof had a leak and caused the bedroom ceiling to bulge down, to the point that the light in the middle of the ceiling wouldn't reach the edges because it was too bowed down. This has also created mould on the ceilings and around the windows. After ignoring our calls and texts for ages the real estate agency finally answered and tried to gaslight us to believe that it was like that when we moved in. They finally sent someone to put a temporary patch on the roof and put wooden planks across our bedroom ceiling to try to hold it up. They finally sent someone again to look at the roof again, and the guy looks at our tile roof and goes "um I do tin roofs" and leaves. They never send someone to look at it again. They then just ignore our messages and calls about it until finally admitting in person that they can't get the landlord to fix it and hes just going to wait until we move out to do renos (which would be almost 2.5 years of it not being repaired) so there's nothing they can do. With the assistance of the tenancy union we gave a notice to terminate which the owner and real estate has said they don't accept. Instead they are trying to get us to spend hundreds of dollars to put the rental back on the market without repairs. Throughout this time, there's been many issues with the plumbing in the house, with the current issue of hot water constandtly streaming from the kitchen sink for at least 6 months that they have not tried to fix. The real estate has also let the owner stop by at our place with less than 24 hours notice.

They knew I worked night shifts and had a baby due in 2 months and they neglected to tell me about the construction all day every day in the unit directly above mine. I can't sleep during the day at all to go to work and I can't even bring my new baby girl home here without her permitly getting damaged ears for the rest of her life. I have tried to call the real estate, police and council multiple times and have received 0 help. Do not move into this unit it is a nightmare

As you step outside you are greeted with THE GREAT WALL OF MEG LANE, a huge retaining wall higher than the roof of the house. Whenever it rains the backyard floods and the water sits for so long it gets mouldy. Because there's no proper sun inside the house it's a weekly job of cleaning mould off the windows and windowsills. The house is either super cold or extremely hot. Aircons face each other so there's no air flow to front of house.

Moved into unmown lawns, and trailer loads of garden waste i was expected to take care of. Had mould in the walls and a roof that leaked onto electricals, had a tree growing over the roof so they ripped all the trees out of the front garden (was basically a rainforest), burst a water pipe in the process, paid a landscaper $1000 to tidy the yard but all he did was leaf blow the leaves off the roof, then the real estate expected me to turn the mud hole into a working front yard, sending me txts every time weeds grew faster than my grass seeds. My shower was also falling through the floor of the house, the deck was rotting and they only replaced each slat as they fell through which resulted in friends and family and pets legs often going through the deck.

Decently sized unit and was reasonably priced for when I was living there. Real estate agent was awful and Landlords were awful - never fixed anything. Unit is very old which would be fine except it was boiling in summer and freezing in winter. Property would shift alot with the seasons and doors didn't close alot of the time. Windows didn't close properly or lock half the time. Kitchen was falling apart. 1 tiny very old and inefficient heater for the whole unit that wouldn't heat unless you were a foot away from it. No cooling in the unit what so ever, not even a fan. No insulation in the wooden floor. Hell the place really could have been improved with some basic door seals and caulking but even that was above the LL's.

When we inspected the property we were told it was going to be demolished in 6 months and it was strictly a 6 month lease. Because of this they justified repairing a broken shower tile with coreflute and duct tape and replaced the back door with a cheap hollow internal door (not painted) with only a twist knob for “security”. The first week we had to install our own deadlock into the floor. The dining room was so slanted the gap between the floor and skirting boards had fungus growing into the room. When we confirmed we were moving out on the final day of the lease we were told that we didn't give enough notice of vacation (confirmed by ACCC) because the demolition was never confirmed. The agent said they don't know when it could happen, could be in a year. We ended up paying the extra 1K in rent. Not the worst place ever but never easy.

They bumped up our rent from $375 to $525 in one jump and the place is a in a bad condition. I had to relocate due to ridiculous price increase. Re occuring mold covering every wall in the laundry room which caused health issues due to the lack of ventilation, they wouldn't solve the mold issue, roof paint peeling every room, cupboards falling apart, shower floor in bathroom not tiled properly after asking months prior to fix it but told they don't plan on doing so. second biggest bedroom light is hanging out of ceiling, has exposed wires, this was not fixed, light in the living room flickers until it blows the light, were told the carpets were gonna be replaced, weren't replaced, the carpets are really old and have irreversible staining from previous tenants.

So much black mould that they refuse to treat. They'll wipe it off the walls, but won't do anything to prevent it from growing right back. The windows do not keep the warm air in. I basically gave myself Asthma from living here.

When viewing the property all seemed good and dandy. However once we moved in and got settled, the problems began. Garage flooded when ever heavy rains occurred, damaging our property. Holes in the floor of the house letting in cold air. Sheets of asbestos filled concrete left in the back yard. Tap that leaked constantly outside. Non of these issues where taken seriously by the agency.

Roof leaked for a solid 3 months, causing kitchen to flood & have wall damage - landlord & real estate didn't fix it during this time bc they said “it's never leaked before though!” despite us sending videos of it everytime it rained. 
Landlord/owner of the units was ALWAYS at the property & doing his own renovations & sending workers through our unit & property without notice. was a shit show the whole 6 months there. 
On top of that, the real estate agent despised me & never acknowledged me, but liked my partner, for reason i'm only assuming is that i'm quiet.

Many repairs needed to the house including; sealing the tiles and waterproofing in the shower, sealing the kitchen sink, no heating for 7 months, old carpet needs replacing, laminate in bathrooms, kitchen and laundry needs replacing, no air con, no dishwasher, oven and stovetop needs updating, pest control in house needs attention (many small cracks let mice and rats inside), mould growth in bathroom unmanageable, fence falling down, poor security with back garage door, kitchen cabinets and bench top need updating.

Furnished unit with 30 year old furniture that does not match. Eg. 8 seat table with 4 chairs that are too short for the table. Queen size bed base with a double bed matteress.  Single bed in spare room with old worn out matteress. Window in master only opens 20 cm. Fridge that has never been serviced in the last 10 years. Leaks water onto floor( very dangerous). No patio front or back.  No screen on master window.

Within the first week mould started appearing on the walls. It grew in the form of cloth marks. I still have all the emails I sent in. Nothing was ever done. The mould was so bad in the ceiling you could see it on the outside of the house after six months. I was able to clean inside the house, but what was going on in the ceiling was horrific. The real estate replied with "but it has a new roof". I followed up to question how long it gone needing a new roof and if the insulation had been changed. They couldn't answer this but were adamant on trying to make it my fault. When we applied we offered more if they could put a dishwasher in. The owner had installed it himself. The pipes behind it had melted to the back of the machine and water was going everywhere. It was never fixed yet I continued to pay rent that included the extra for a dishwasher. The gas oven was rusted out. The owner actually turned up for this and installed a second hand one himself- that didn't work and was never fixed again. During our time in this house we never missed rent and had the house spotless when they came for the inspections, Until my husband died. literally within weeks of me informing them he had passed away I had an inspection and this time, I didn't get rid of the mould growing in the shape of the roof batons in the ceiling. I didn't scrub and when a new agent (never had the same agent) came for the inspection I told her how over it I was. She told the owner that the work had to be done!!! his reply was to evict me. I decide to move states. I had gone through hell. My husband had been killed by a drunk driver, I had found out my youngest was special needs and evicted. So I paid cleaners $900 to do an end of lease clean and a guy $200 to make sure the yards were good and left. The photos provided to me showed it was clean and tidy. Just like the two single women who had rented before me (neighbour informed) they took my full bond. I was grieving, in Queensland with no strength to fight it so I just let it go as I was buying a house so the loss of it wasn't detrimental to my rental history or ability to have a roof over my head. I have since seen many people saying the real estate had tried to take their full bonds. That it was what they do. If you fought it you got it back, if you didn't like me you lost the whole thing. I contacted the local council with a tip off to have it looked at to be condemned, we were always sick when we lived there and I didn't want another family going through this. I don't think anything was done.

The place is full of mould, the pool that isn't part of the tenancy leaks under the house causing all the flooring and built ins to break. You can clean the mould over and over again but as it comes back it's worse. They've painted the bench and tiles. The bathroom is completely painted. They take your bond for things to replace but don't actually replace them.

You get charged an arm and a leg to live next door to owners ex wife who harasses and abuses tenants daily, calls them nasty names, pretends to spit on them, blower vacs all her leaves over to other units, tells you that you can't park on the street, can't have visitors, writes letters telling you that if we can't be her friend we will have out lease ended/ not renewed and our rent increased. Even with security cameras this stops nothing. 1000% don't recommend!
Windowsills rotten, holes in bricks for moisture to get in, constant mould, refused to reduce rent, refused to fix, lied about owner moving back in when evicting me with no notice.

Spent three months without heating as realestate were uncooperative. Although we were renting through a real estate the land lord's elderly parents let themselves into the property whilst nobody was home with their own keys to “do maintenance” and damaged my own white goods in the process. 90% of the repairs during my stay here were completed by the landlords parents. We once requested the shower be re-grouted (it was sinking into the water damaged floor boards) and the parents chose so superglue metal over the grout gaps instead. The Landlord once came to review the rotting floor boards (as kitchen flooded every single time we used the shower) and during this visit he'd parked in our neighbours driveway.. he argued with her about how it doesn't matter if she leases the property from him, at the end of the day it's his house and he'll park in the driveway if he wanted…. Also obligatory there was mould and extremely poor ventilation. Had to throw ALL my clothing and furniture out when we moved as everything was mouldy. for one, the house was absolutely falling apart, the foundations of the house were crumbling and there was asbestos in the roof. the second reason is that the real estate and landlord tried to evict my assistance dog from the property and when i acquired legal assistance (and won) they just pretended to sell the property to remove us when our lease ended.

MOULD. We lived at 1 Annandale St, Annandale for 12 weeks before we had to terminate and vacate. The mould wouldn't grow on the walls due to fresh “anti mould” paint, but after 12 weeks it was on the floors, under all of our mattress, on our clothes, shoes, kitchen and furniture. Everything we owned was covered in it. The hot water system didn't work for a week in the middle of winter. Water leaked through the ceiling lights when it rained and the light switches would electrically shock you. None of the windows shut properly so the house was constantly freezing and breezy.

Also to top it off, when we moved in the place hadn't been cleaned after the tradespeople  had renovated. There was dust, plaster, nails, staples, dirty tissues, cigarette butts, dried urine over the toilet seat and BLOOD sprayed on some of the doors and walls. It took three days until the agency organized a cleaner and by then we had already cleaned up because we needed to move in. The garden was completely overgrown and the agency tried to take our bond because the “grass wasn't cut short enough” even though we had mowed it two days prior and it was drastically shorter than when we originally got the keys. Then they said we needed to sweep the pavement in order to get our bond back. Luckily I had photos of it originally swept and then attached a screenshot of the 40-60km wind report that had occurred on the days since.
Bad Owners. Mould in building. [REDACTED] and also refuses to fix anything and people who live here have gone without water for more then a week

The roof leaks so badly that lights stopped working and some walls have water dripping down them every time it rains, to the point that mushrooms sprout under the carpets. It damaged our mattress. Water damage through out and took 18months to fix a leaking roof. Mound and old bad carpet. No aircon and very limited windows to get airflow. Temperature inside exceeded 40 degrees in summer. Photos were lovely and taken from angles that made it look bigger. When inspected it was dirty, small and questionable of safety standards.

this house is in an absolute state of disrepair, all repairs done are just cover ups, the pool is unmanageable, it is unpainted, filter is for 30,000 litre pool but the pool is 60,000 litres, and there is cracks in it, the kitchen has been deemed a health hazard by plumber (we have suffered Allergic Rhinitis for 2 years likely caused by black mould) wooden cupboards in kitchen rotting, stove top doesn't work properly, oven doesn't work properly, bathroom fans don't work, lounge room fan doesn't work, bedroom 2 and 3 fans don't work, stove fan doesn't work, granny flat kitchenette is illegally installed and ordered to be removed by council which the owners re installed once council stopped inspecting, solar panels don't work, house was built on top of a creek in the 80's so it is flood prone and has water damage on all window and door frames and kitchen cupboards, theres a severe rodent infestation, faulty locks on side door makes getting in without key super easy, i wish i could attach photos to this.

I've been living here for 3 years, didn't have a problem until about 6mnths ago when my neighbour in unit 3 made it aware that she has been stalking me for the last 3 years and made it known by harrassing me through the (very thin) wall that separates my bedroom to her (presumed) lounge room. In the 3yrs I've been here, I've never seen this lady since she never leaves her house so I have no idea what she looks like, how old she is or even her name. She made it known that she had an issue with the level of noise coming from my apartment by spending all night on the phone (or talking to herself?) about everything I do in my apartment and how it annoys her, everything from my singing in the shower, to my TV playing, even going as far as recording me in my own apartment and playing it back through the night. She was knocking on my walls, throwing things at my garden shed, pacing back and forth near my bedroom, laughing manically at 7am and screaming like a psycho late at night! I've endured weeks of sleepless nights, even having to go to the hospital because it triggered my PTSD. Her harassment didn't settle down until I involved police to go speak to her to make her stop. Even now I don't feel comfortable in my own home and don't invite anyone over anymore. I can't take phone appointments in my own house without fear of her listening in on my conversation and hearing my personal information. I'm saving up enough money and moving out of this shithole and not looking back! I warn anyone who looks at this rental to apply with caution, you will not have privacy and she could potentially play her games with the next tenant seeing that what she has done has forced me to relocate. I feel sorry for the next person who has to live here.

The landlord is a slumlord and has raised the rent 5 times in the past 2.5 years but done no maintenance or repairs sends a gardener 3 times a year to trim public areas in the complex and the Green Sink for stormwater runoff which is suppossed to be kept clear of vegetation is full of rubbish and overgrowth including a gum tree which I have seen grow from a seed to about 7 or 8m tall.  There is also Prickly pear growing in the drains.  The concrete area is overgrown black with mould and and the fences are cheap nasty and falling down at the back of the property.  There is mould in the drains giving off an ordour that is gut wrending and despite treatments by the tenants, the Agent and Landlord refuse to get a plumber to fix it. This property and the entire complex of 15 units at 11 Province Street Boondall is falling apart and not maintained or repaired by the Slumlords or Agents who both are the worst I have ever had to deal with in nearly 40 years of renting all across Australia.
The landlord was a nightmare but the property manager was good

Mould throughout bathroom and wet areas, ceiling leaks anytime there is rain, most of the windows are painted shut, windows have massive gaps as the glass is smaller than the frames leading to the property being an ice box in winter, have to heat the entire property off a single one-room AC unit because the heater in the living room is broken. It's one. single. bedroom. Whatever they're charging it's way too much- very little privacy and they're obviously taking you for a ride with the price. It's student housing but at a full houses' cost. The house rules are a bit full on for what youre paying as well.

Where do I start. This unit sits in a 3 property complex, the man in unit one would regularly turn off my water and look into my house and talk about what he could see as the the second bedroom looks into his backyard. The woman in unit 3, also the landlords daughter, struggled with a drug addiction and had me up at all hours calling the police due to concerns of her welfare/self harm concerns. The landlords other daughter came to my house and asked me to monitor the comings and goings of her sister.. also her boyfriend was a drug dealer and I was warned that they were both dangerous and not to approach. Feels safe right? They would regularly text me and ask me to check her whereabouts which I refused to do for my own safety. The house also has a serious mould issue in the second bedroom and kitchen area which had to be treated twice with no improvements. My favourite part was when they tore out the mouldy shelves below the kitchen counter and told me to “find other ways” to store my things in the kitchen… never mind that the under bench storage is the only storage available there. Whilst I was there the electrical box had to be replaced. I had to spend a whole day without electricity even though I was working from home, when I was told it was only going to be a 3 hour exercise. Again this was my fault for not arranging for the whole day off. When I asked to be released from my lease due to the unhealthy living environment (I ended up having serious respiratory issues due to the dampness and mould contaminating the house) as well as stress from the far from usual living situation with the other tenants, I was actually called up by another property manager who tried to bully me for feeling unsafe. Really great stuff Trimson.

We inspected the property and were promised by the managing agency that all issues with the property would be fixed prior to moving in. Upon moving in, we discovered that doors could not be locked and were kept shut by garbage bins being placed behind the door. There were broken floors resulting in injuries, water leak in the bathroom resulting in a flooded house, cat faeces everywhere and mould in the bathroom. The managing agency didn't want to do any repairs in which we took the managing agency to NCAT as a result, the managing agency attempted to evict us and rose our rent by more than double (from $300/wk to $750/wk). The managing agency also applied to NCAT to get an eviction order and an order for  unpaid rent. Eventually NCAT rejected the managing agencies applications and made an order for repairs to be made in conjunction to a reduced rate of rent. The managing agency than accused us of changing locks to the property (padlock on mailbox) and applied again to NCAT to have us evicted. Again, the managing agency failed. After non stop harassment and abuse from the agency we eventually broke our lease only a month in. We thought this would be the end of it but the managing agency applied to NCAT AGAIN for alledged monies owed for damages to the property. NCAT determined that the "damages" were pre-existing before we had moved in and was also mentioned and prior cases at NCAT. Overall, after the managing agency made over 8 applications to NCAT they were not successful with any of them.

The balcony was falling off into the driveway, so we couldn't use the driveway/garage. The walls had more scuff marks than white, dings and scratches/holes you'd think someone was using the place as a live-in art piece. The ceilings yellow. Previous tenant had requested two years prior that these issues be addressed when she moved in.

The water always tasted a bit funny. It had a manky smell which we realised later was mould and old pipes (landlords refused this claim, but was in the South of France holidaying so was not interested in dealing with his investment properties at the time). 

The place flooded over xmas when everyone was away, from top floor to bottom. Due to the flood the lights downstairs in the kitchen didn't work, and the fridge shorted often. They ripped up the carpets after about a month of complaints, we stayed with partners/friends or went home as the smell was pungent and conditions ick. The state of the floor with the carpets ripped up was more alarming, with lots of gross looking spots, holes, and growths... and miscellaneous bugs this had brought up. Perfect for the bedrooms. We had fans running to try get rid of the smell and moisture. A tradie came through and inspected saying that there was structural damage as the upstairs shower sealed and continued to leak into the internal structure. We were advised not to use the showers.

Landlords kept running trades people through (with no notice)but nothing was done. We were then served a notice to vacate. They stole our bond and claimed we'd caused 35K of damages-- threating us with an invoice and legal action. Refusing to provide condition reports over the past years, or inspections, but upped the rent. The agency refused to change any of the bond/lease over so we'd done it informally (sharehouse for 14+ yrs); no way to a VCAT case if you technically didn't live there; and couldn't get in touch with those listed on the bond. We had 12 different property managers in the space of the 6mths I was there. Looks like they've done a couple quick fixes outside, but it's still a shit hole, with an awful property management org and disgusting landlord.

Many repairs needed to the house including; sealing the tiles and waterproofing in the shower, sealing the kitchen sink, no heating for 7 months, old carpet needs replacing, laminate in bathrooms, kitchen and laundry needs replacing, no air con, no dishwasher, oven and stovetop needs updating, pest control in house needs attention (many small cracks let mice and rats inside), mould growth in bathroom unmanageable, fence falling down, poor security with back garage door, kitchen cabinets and bench top need updating.
